CHAPTER 110. Queequeg in His Coffin.
NOOOOOO noo. Nooooooo no Noo Nooooo.







Upon searching, it was found that the casks last struck into the hold
Nooo noooooooo, no noo noooo nooo noo noooo nooo nooooo nooo noo nooo

were perfectly sound, and that the leak must be further off. So, it
nooo noooooooo noooo, noo nooo noo nooo nooo no noooooo noo. No, no

being calm weather, they broke out deeper and deeper, disturbing the
noooo nooo noooooo, nooo noooo noo nooooo noo nooooo, nooooooooo noo

slumbers of the huge ground-tier butts; and from that black midnight
nooooooo no noo nooo nooooo-nooo noooo; noo nooo nooo noooo nooooooo

sending those gigantic moles into the daylight above. So deep did they
noooooo noooo nooooooo noooo nooo noo nooooooo noooo. No nooo noo nooo

go; and so ancient, and corroded, and weedy the aspect of the lowermost
no; noo no noooooo, noo nooooooo, noo noooo noo nooooo no noo noooooooo

puncheons, that you almost looked next for some mouldy corner-stone cask
noooooooo, nooo noo nooooo nooooo nooo noo nooo nooooo nooooo-noooo nooo

containing coins of Captain Noah, with copies of the posted placards,
nooooooooo noooo no Noooooo Nooo, nooo nooooo no noo nooooo nooooooo,

vainly warning the infatuated old world from the flood. Tierce after
nooooo noooooo noo nooooooooo noo noooo nooo noo noooo. Nooooo noooo

tierce, too, of water, and bread, and beef, and shooks of staves, and
nooooo, noo, no noooo, noo noooo, noo nooo, noo nooooo no nooooo, noo

iron bundles of hoops, were hoisted out, till at last the piled decks
nooo noooooo no noooo, nooo noooooo noo, nooo no nooo noo noooo noooo

were hard to get about; and the hollow hull echoed under foot, as if
nooo nooo no noo noooo; noo noo nooooo nooo nooooo noooo nooo, no no

you were treading over empty catacombs, and reeled and rolled in the sea
noo nooo nooooooo nooo noooo noooooooo, noo nooooo noo nooooo no noo noo

like an air-freighted demijohn. Top-heavy was the ship as a dinnerless
nooo no noo-noooooooo nooooooo. Noo-noooo noo noo nooo no n nooooooooo

student with all Aristotle in his head. Well was it that the Typhoons
noooooo nooo noo Noooooooo no noo nooo. Nooo noo no nooo noo Nooooooo

did not visit them then.
noo noo noooo nooo nooo.




Now, at this time it was that my poor pagan companion, and fast
Noo, no nooo nooo no noo nooo no nooo noooo noooooooo, noo nooo

bosom-friend, Queequeg, was seized with a fever, which brought him nigh
noooo-nooooo, Nooooooo, noo nooooo nooo n noooo, noooo noooooo noo nooo

to his endless end.
no noo noooooo noo.




Be it said, that in this vocation of whaling, sinecures are unknown;
No no nooo, nooo no nooo nooooooo no noooooo, noooooooo noo noooooo;

dignity and danger go hand in hand; till you get to be Captain, the
noooooo noo nooooo no nooo no nooo; nooo noo noo no no Noooooo, noo

higher you rise the harder you toil. So with poor Queequeg, who, as
nooooo noo nooo noo nooooo noo nooo. No nooo nooo Nooooooo, noo, no

harpooneer, must not only face all the rage of the living whale, but--as
nooooooooo, nooo noo nooo nooo noo noo nooo no noo nooooo noooo, noo--no

we have elsewhere seen--mount his dead back in a rolling sea; and
no nooo noooooooo nooo--noooo noo nooo nooo no n noooooo noo; noo

finally descend into the gloom of the hold, and bitterly sweating
noooooo noooooo nooo noo noooo no noo nooo, noo nooooooo nooooooo

all day in that subterraneous confinement, resolutely manhandle the
noo noo no nooo noooooooooooo noooooooooo, nooooooooo noooooooo noo

clumsiest casks and see to their stowage. To be short, among whalemen,
noooooooo noooo noo noo no noooo noooooo. No no noooo, noooo nooooooo,

the harpooneers are the holders, so called.
noo noooooooooo noo noo noooooo, no nooooo.




Poor Queequeg! when the ship was about half disembowelled, you should
Nooo Nooooooo! nooo noo nooo noo noooo nooo noooooooooooo, noo nooooo

have stooped over the hatchway, and peered down upon him there; where,
nooo noooooo nooo noo nooooooo, noo nooooo nooo nooo noo noooo; noooo,

stripped to his woollen drawers, the tattooed savage was crawling about
nooooooo no noo noooooo noooooo, noo nooooooo nooooo noo nooooooo noooo

amid that dampness and slime, like a green spotted lizard at the bottom
nooo nooo nooooooo noo noooo, nooo n noooo noooooo nooooo no noo nooooo

of a well. And a well, or an ice-house, it somehow proved to him, poor
no n nooo. Noo n nooo, no no noo-noooo, no noooooo nooooo no noo, nooo

pagan; where, strange to say, for all the heat of his sweatings, he
noooo; noooo, noooooo no noo, noo noo noo nooo no noo noooooooo, no

caught a terrible chill which lapsed into a fever; and at last, after
nooooo n nooooooo noooo noooo nooooo nooo n noooo; noo no nooo, noooo

some days' suffering, laid him in his hammock, close to the very sill
nooo nooo' noooooooo, nooo noo no noo noooooo, noooo no noo nooo nooo

of the door of death. How he wasted and wasted away in those few
no noo nooo no noooo. Noo no nooooo noo nooooo nooo no noooo noo

long-lingering days, till there seemed but little left of him but his
nooo-noooooooo nooo, nooo noooo nooooo noo nooooo nooo no noo noo noo

frame and tattooing. But as all else in him thinned, and his cheek-bones
noooo noo noooooooo. Noo no noo nooo no noo noooooo, noo noo noooo-noooo

grew sharper, his eyes, nevertheless, seemed growing fuller and fuller;
nooo noooooo, noo nooo, nooooooooooo, nooooo noooooo nooooo noo nooooo;

they became of a strange softness of lustre; and mildly but deeply
nooo nooooo no n noooooo nooooooo no nooooo; noo nooooo noo nooooo

looked out at you there from his sickness, a wondrous testimony to that
nooooo noo no noo noooo nooo noo nooooooo, n nooooooo noooooooo no nooo

immortal health in him which could not die, or be weakened. And like
nooooooo nooooo no noo noooo noooo noo noo, no no nooooooo. Noo nooo

circles on the water, which, as they grow fainter, expand; so his eyes
noooooo no noo noooo, noooo, no nooo nooo noooooo, nooooo; no noo nooo

seemed rounding and rounding, like the rings of Eternity. An awe that
nooooo nooooooo noo nooooooo, nooo noo noooo no Nooooooo. No noo nooo

cannot be named would steal over you as you sat by the side of this
nooooo no noooo noooo noooo nooo noo no noo noo no noo nooo no nooo

waning savage, and saw as strange things in his face, as any beheld who
nooooo nooooo, noo noo no noooooo nooooo no noo nooo, no noo nooooo noo

were bystanders when Zoroaster died. For whatever is truly wondrous and
nooo nooooooooo nooo Noooooooo nooo. Noo nooooooo no noooo nooooooo noo

fearful in man, never yet was put into words or books. And the drawing
noooooo no noo, noooo noo noo noo nooo noooo no noooo. Noo noo noooooo

near of Death, which alike levels all, alike impresses all with a last
nooo no Noooo, noooo noooo nooooo noo, noooo noooooooo noo nooo n nooo

revelation, which only an author from the dead could adequately tell.
nooooooooo, noooo nooo no nooooo nooo noo nooo noooo nooooooooo nooo.

So that--let us say it again--no dying Chaldee or Greek had higher and
No nooo--noo no noo no noooo--no noooo Noooooo no Noooo noo nooooo noo

holier thoughts than those, whose mysterious shades you saw creeping
nooooo nooooooo nooo noooo, noooo nooooooooo nooooo noo noo nooooooo

over the face of poor Queequeg, as he quietly lay in his swaying
nooo noo nooo no nooo Nooooooo, no no noooooo noo no noo noooooo

hammock, and the rolling sea seemed gently rocking him to his final
noooooo, noo noo noooooo noo nooooo nooooo noooooo noo no noo noooo

rest, and the ocean's invisible flood-tide lifted him higher and higher
nooo, noo noo noooo'n noooooooo noooo-nooo nooooo noo nooooo noo nooooo

towards his destined heaven.
noooooo noo nooooooo nooooo.




Not a man of the crew but gave him up; and, as for Queequeg himself,
Noo n noo no noo nooo noo nooo noo no; noo, no noo Nooooooo noooooo,

what he thought of his case was forcibly shown by a curious favour he
nooo no noooooo no noo nooo noo nooooooo noooo no n noooooo nooooo no

asked. He called one to him in the grey morning watch, when the day was
noooo. No nooooo noo no noo no noo nooo noooooo noooo, nooo noo noo noo

just breaking, and taking his hand, said that while in Nantucket he
nooo nooooooo, noo nooooo noo nooo, nooo nooo noooo no Noooooooo no

had chanced to see certain little canoes of dark wood, like the rich
noo noooooo no noo noooooo nooooo nooooo no nooo nooo, nooo noo nooo

war-wood of his native isle; and upon inquiry, he had learned that all
noo-nooo no noo nooooo nooo; noo nooo noooooo, no noo noooooo nooo noo

whalemen who died in Nantucket, were laid in those same dark canoes,
nooooooo noo nooo no Noooooooo, nooo nooo no noooo nooo nooo nooooo,

and that the fancy of being so laid had much pleased him; for it was not
noo nooo noo noooo no noooo no nooo noo nooo noooooo noo; noo no noo noo

unlike the custom of his own race, who, after embalming a dead warrior,
nooooo noo nooooo no noo noo nooo, noo, noooo noooooooo n nooo noooooo,

stretched him out in his canoe, and so left him to be floated away to
noooooooo noo noo no noo noooo, noo no nooo noo no no noooooo nooo no

the starry archipelagoes; for not only do they believe that the stars
noo nooooo noooooooooooo; noo noo nooo no nooo noooooo nooo noo noooo

are isles, but that far beyond all visible horizons, their own mild,
noo noooo, noo nooo noo nooooo noo noooooo nooooooo, noooo noo nooo,

uncontinented seas, interflow with the blue heavens; and so form the
noooooooooooo nooo, noooooooo nooo noo nooo noooooo; noo no nooo noo

white breakers of the milky way. He added, that he shuddered at
noooo nooooooo no noo noooo noo. No noooo, nooo no noooooooo no

the thought of being buried in his hammock, according to the usual
noo noooooo no noooo nooooo no noo noooooo, noooooooo no noo noooo

sea-custom, tossed like something vile to the death-devouring sharks.
noo-nooooo, nooooo nooo noooooooo nooo no noo noooo-noooooooo nooooo.

No: he desired a canoe like those of Nantucket, all the more congenial
No: no noooooo n noooo nooo noooo no Noooooooo, noo noo nooo noooooooo

to him, being a whaleman, that like a whale-boat these coffin-canoes
no noo, noooo n nooooooo, nooo nooo n noooo-nooo noooo nooooo-nooooo

were without a keel; though that involved but uncertain steering, and
nooo noooooo n nooo; nooooo nooo nooooooo noo noooooooo nooooooo, noo

much lee-way adown the dim ages.
nooo noo-noo noooo noo noo nooo.




Now, when this strange circumstance was made known aft, the carpenter
Noo, nooo nooo noooooo nooooooooooo noo nooo noooo noo, noo noooooooo

was at once commanded to do Queequeg's bidding, whatever it might
noo no nooo noooooooo no no Nooooooo'n noooooo, nooooooo no noooo

include. There was some heathenish, coffin-coloured old lumber aboard,
noooooo. Noooo noo nooo nooooooooo, nooooo-nooooooo noo nooooo nooooo,

which, upon a long previous voyage, had been cut from the aboriginal
noooo, nooo n nooo nooooooo nooooo, noo nooo noo nooo noo nooooooooo

nooooo no noo Nooooooo noooooo, noo nooo noooo nooo nooooo noo nooooo

was recommended to be made. No sooner was the carpenter apprised of
noo noooooooooo no no nooo. No nooooo noo noo noooooooo nooooooo no

noo noooo, nooo nooooo noo nooo, no noooooooo nooo noo noo noooooooooo

noooooooooo no noo noooooooo, noooooooo nooo noo nooooooooo noo nooo

Queequeg's measure with great accuracy, regularly chalking Queequeg's
Nooooooo'n noooooo nooo noooo nooooooo, noooooooo nooooooo Nooooooo'n

person as he shifted the rule.
nooooo no no noooooo noo nooo.




"Ah! poor fellow! he'll have to die now," ejaculated the Long Island
"No! nooo nooooo! no'no nooo no noo noo," nooooooooo noo Nooo Nooooo

sailor.
nooooo.




Going to his vice-bench, the carpenter for convenience sake and general
Noooo no noo nooo-noooo, noo noooooooo noo noooooooooo nooo noo noooooo

reference, now transferringly measured on it the exact length the coffin
noooooooo, noo nooooooooooooo nooooooo no no noo noooo nooooo noo nooooo

noo no no, noo nooo nooo noo nooooooo noooooooo no noooooo noo noooooo

no noo noooooooooo. Nooo nooo, no nooooooooo noo nooooo noo noo noooo,

and to work.
noo no nooo.




When the last nail was driven, and the lid duly planed and fitted,
Nooo noo nooo nooo noo nooooo, noo noo noo nooo nooooo noo nooooo,

he lightly shouldered the coffin and went forward with it, inquiring
no noooooo nooooooooo noo nooooo noo nooo noooooo nooo no, noooooooo

whether they were ready for it yet in that direction.
noooooo nooo nooo noooo noo no noo no nooo noooooooo.




Overhearing the indignant but half-humorous cries with which the
Noooooooooo noo noooooooo noo nooo-nooooooo noooo nooo noooo noo

people on deck began to drive the coffin away, Queequeg, to every one's
nooooo no nooo noooo no noooo noo nooooo nooo, Nooooooo, no noooo noo'n

consternation, commanded that the thing should be instantly brought to
noooooooooooo, noooooooo nooo noo noooo nooooo no noooooooo noooooo no

him, nor was there any denying him; seeing that, of all mortals, some
noo, noo noo noooo noo noooooo noo; nooooo nooo, no noo noooooo, nooo

dying men are the most tyrannical; and certainly, since they will
noooo noo noo noo nooo nooooooooo; noo noooooooo, noooo nooo nooo

shortly trouble us so little for evermore, the poor fellows ought to be
noooooo noooooo no no nooooo noo nooooooo, noo nooo noooooo noooo no no

indulged.
nooooooo.




Leaning over in his hammock, Queequeg long regarded the coffin with
Noooooo nooo no noo noooooo, Nooooooo nooo nooooooo noo nooooo nooo

an attentive eye. He then called for his harpoon, had the wooden stock
no noooooooo noo. No nooo nooooo noo noo noooooo, noo noo nooooo noooo

drawn from it, and then had the iron part placed in the coffin along
noooo nooo no, noo nooo noo noo nooo nooo nooooo no noo nooooo noooo

with one of the paddles of his boat. All by his own request, also,
nooo noo no noo noooooo no noo nooo. Noo no noo noo noooooo, nooo,

biscuits were then ranged round the sides within: a flask of fresh water
nooooooo nooo nooo nooooo noooo noo noooo nooooo: n noooo no noooo noooo

was placed at the head, and a small bag of woody earth scraped up in
noo nooooo no noo nooo, noo n noooo noo no noooo noooo noooooo no no

the hold at the foot; and a piece of sail-cloth being rolled up for a
noo nooo no noo nooo; noo n noooo no nooo-noooo noooo nooooo no noo n

pillow, Queequeg now entreated to be lifted into his final bed, that he
nooooo, Nooooooo noo noooooooo no no nooooo nooo noo noooo noo, nooo no

might make trial of its comforts, if any it had. He lay without moving
noooo nooo noooo no noo nooooooo, no noo no noo. No noo noooooo nooooo

a few minutes, then told one to go to his bag and bring out his little
n noo noooooo, nooo nooo noo no no no noo noo noo noooo noo noo nooooo

god, Yojo. Then crossing his arms on his breast with Yojo between, he
noo, Nooo. Nooo nooooooo noo nooo no noo nooooo nooo Nooo noooooo, no

called for the coffin lid (hatch he called it) to be placed over him.
nooooo noo noo nooooo noo (noooo no nooooo no) no no nooooo nooo noo.

The head part turned over with a leather hinge, and there lay Queequeg
Noo nooo nooo nooooo nooo nooo n noooooo noooo, noo noooo noo Nooooooo

in his coffin with little but his composed countenance in view. "Rarmai"
no noo nooooo nooo nooooo noo noo nooooooo noooooooooo no nooo. "Nooooo"

(it will do; it is easy), he murmured at last, and signed to be replaced
(no nooo no; no no nooo), no nooooooo no nooo, noo nooooo no no nooooooo

in his hammock.
no noo noooooo.




But ere this was done, Pip, who had been slily hovering near by all this
Noo noo nooo noo nooo, Noo, noo noo nooo noooo nooooooo nooo no noo nooo

while, drew nigh to him where he lay, and with soft sobbings, took him
noooo, nooo nooo no noo noooo no noo, noo nooo nooo nooooooo, nooo noo

by the hand; in the other, holding his tambourine.
no noo nooo; no noo noooo, noooooo noo nooooooooo.




"Poor rover! will ye never have done with all this weary roving? where
"Nooo noooo! nooo no noooo nooo nooo nooo noo nooo noooo nooooo? noooo

go ye now? But if the currents carry ye to those sweet Antilles where
no no noo? Noo no noo nooooooo noooo no no noooo noooo Nooooooo noooo

noo noooooo noo nooo nooo nooo noooo-nooooo, nooo no no noo nooooo

nooooo noo no? Nooo noo noo Noo, noo'n noo nooo noooooo nooo: N noooo

no'n no noooo noo Nooooooo. No no nooo noo, nooo noooooo noo; noo no

no. Noo-n-noo, noo, noo! Noo, Nooooooo, noo; noo N'no nooo no nooo noooo

march."
noooo."




"I have heard," murmured Starbuck, gazing down the scuttle, "that in
"N nooo noooo," nooooooo Nooooooo, nooooo nooo noo noooooo, "nooo no

violent fevers, men, all ignorance, have talked in ancient tongues;
noooooo nooooo, noo, noo noooooooo, nooo nooooo no noooooo noooooo;

and that when the mystery is probed, it turns out always that in their
noo nooo nooo noo noooooo no nooooo, no noooo noo nooooo nooo no noooo

nooooo noooooooo noooooooo noooo noooooo noooooo noo nooo nooooo nooooo

no noooo noooooo no nooo noooo nooooooo. No, no no nooo noooo, nooo Noo,

no nooo noooooo noooooooo no noo nooooo, nooooo nooooooo nooooooo no noo

noo nooooooo noooo. Noooo noooooo no nooo, noo noooo?--Nooo! no nooooo

again: but more wildly now."
noooo: noo nooo nooooo noo."




"Form two and two! Let's make a General of him! Ho, where's his harpoon?
"Nooo noo noo noo! Noo'n nooo n Noooooo no noo! No, noooo'n noo noooooo?

Noo no nooooo nooo.--Noo-n-noo, noo, noo! noooo! No noo n nooo nooo

noo no noo nooo noo nooo noo nooo! Nooooooo nooo nooo!--nooo no nooo;

Nooooooo nooo nooo!--nooo no nooo nooo no nooo; Nooooooo nooo nooo! N

noooo-nooo. Noooo! noooo!"




During all this, Queequeg lay with closed eyes, as if in a dream. Pip
Nooooo noo nooo, Nooooooo noo nooo nooooo nooo, no no no n noooo. Noo

was led away, and the sick man was replaced in his hammock.
noo noo nooo, noo noo nooo noo noo nooooooo no noo noooooo.




But now that he had apparently made every preparation for death; now
Noo noo nooo no noo nooooooooo nooo noooo noooooooooo noo noooo; noo

that his coffin was proved a good fit, Queequeg suddenly rallied; soon
nooo noo nooooo noo nooooo n nooo noo, Nooooooo nooooooo noooooo; nooo

there seemed no need of the carpenter's box: and thereupon, when some
noooo nooooo no nooo no noo noooooooo'n noo: noo noooooooo, nooo nooo

expressed their delighted surprise, he, in substance, said, that the
noooooooo noooo noooooooo nooooooo, no, no noooooooo, nooo, nooo noo

cause of his sudden convalescence was this;--at a critical moment, he
noooo no noo nooooo noooooooooooo noo nooo;--no n nooooooo nooooo, no

had just recalled a little duty ashore, which he was leaving undone;
noo nooo nooooooo n nooooo nooo nooooo, noooo no noo noooooo nooooo;

and therefore had changed his mind about dying: he could not die yet,
noo noooooooo noo noooooo noo nooo noooo noooo: no noooo noo noo noo,

he averred. They asked him, then, whether to live or die was a matter of
no noooooo. Nooo noooo noo, nooo, noooooo no nooo no noo noo n nooooo no

his own sovereign will and pleasure. He answered, certainly. In a word,
noo noo noooooooo nooo noo nooooooo. No nooooooo, noooooooo. No n nooo,

it was Queequeg's conceit, that if a man made up his mind to live, mere
no noo Nooooooo'n noooooo, nooo no n noo nooo no noo nooo no nooo, nooo

sickness could not kill him: nothing but a whale, or a gale, or some
nooooooo noooo noo nooo noo: noooooo noo n noooo, no n nooo, no nooo

violent, ungovernable, unintelligent destroyer of that sort.
noooooo, nooooooooooo, noooooooooooo noooooooo no nooo nooo.




Now, there is this noteworthy difference between savage and civilized;
Noo, noooo no nooo nooooooooo nooooooooo noooooo nooooo noo noooooooo;

that while a sick, civilized man may be six months convalescing,
nooo noooo n nooo, noooooooo noo noo no noo nooooo nooooooooooo,

generally speaking, a sick savage is almost half-well again in a day.
noooooooo nooooooo, n nooo nooooo no nooooo nooo-nooo noooo no n noo.

So, in good time my Queequeg gained strength; and at length after
No, no nooo nooo no Nooooooo nooooo nooooooo; noo no nooooo noooo

sitting on the windlass for a few indolent days (but eating with a
noooooo no noo nooooooo noo n noo nooooooo nooo (noo nooooo nooo n

vigorous appetite) he suddenly leaped to his feet, threw out his arms
nooooooo nooooooo) no nooooooo nooooo no noo nooo, noooo noo noo nooo

and legs, gave himself a good stretching, yawned a little bit, and then
noo nooo, nooo noooooo n nooo nooooooooo, nooooo n nooooo noo, noo nooo

springing into the head of his hoisted boat, and poising a harpoon,
noooooooo nooo noo nooo no noo noooooo nooo, noo noooooo n noooooo,

pronounced himself fit for a fight.
nooooooooo noooooo noo noo n noooo.




With a wild whimsiness, he now used his coffin for a sea-chest; and
Nooo n nooo nooooooooo, no noo nooo noo nooooo noo n noo-noooo; noo

emptying into it his canvas bag of clothes, set them in order there.
nooooooo nooo no noo nooooo noo no noooooo, noo nooo no noooo noooo.

Many spare hours he spent, in carving the lid with all manner of
Nooo noooo noooo no noooo, no noooooo noo noo nooo noo nooooo no

grotesque figures and drawings; and it seemed that hereby he was
noooooooo noooooo noo nooooooo; noo no nooooo nooo nooooo no noo

striving, in his rude way, to copy parts of the twisted tattooing on
nooooooo, no noo nooo noo, no nooo noooo no noo noooooo noooooooo no

his body. And this tattooing had been the work of a departed prophet and
noo nooo. Noo nooo noooooooo noo nooo noo nooo no n nooooooo noooooo noo

seer of his island, who, by those hieroglyphic marks, had written out on
nooo no noo nooooo, noo, no noooo nooooooooooo noooo, noo noooooo noo no

his body a complete theory of the heavens and the earth, and a mystical
noo nooo n nooooooo nooooo no noo noooooo noo noo noooo, noo n nooooooo

treatise on the art of attaining truth; so that Queequeg in his own
nooooooo no noo noo no noooooooo noooo; no nooo Nooooooo no noo noo

proper person was a riddle to unfold; a wondrous work in one volume; but
nooooo nooooo noo n nooooo no nooooo; n nooooooo nooo no noo nooooo; noo

whose mysteries not even himself could read, though his own live heart
noooo noooooooo noo nooo noooooo noooo nooo, nooooo noo noo nooo noooo

beat against them; and these mysteries were therefore destined in
nooo noooooo nooo; noo noooo noooooooo nooo noooooooo nooooooo no

the end to moulder away with the living parchment whereon they were
noo noo no noooooo nooo nooo noo nooooo noooooooo noooooo nooo nooo

inscribed, and so be unsolved to the last. And this thought it must
noooooooo, noo no no nooooooo no noo nooo. Noo nooo noooooo no nooo

have been which suggested to Ahab that wild exclamation of his, when
nooo nooo noooo noooooooo no Nooo nooo nooo noooooooooo no noo, nooo

one morning turning away from surveying poor Queequeg--"Oh, devilish
noo noooooo noooooo nooo nooo noooooooo nooo Nooooooo--"No, nooooooo

tantalization of the gods!"
noooooooooooo no noo nooo!"










CHAPTER 111. The Pacific.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Noooooo.







When gliding by the Bashee isles we emerged at last upon the great South
Nooo noooooo no noo Nooooo noooo no noooooo no nooo nooo noo noooo Noooo

Sea; were it not for other things, I could have greeted my dear Pacific
Noo; nooo no noo noo noooo nooooo, N noooo nooo noooooo no nooo Noooooo

with uncounted thanks, for now the long supplication of my youth was
nooo noooooooo nooooo, noo noo noo nooo nooooooooooo no no noooo noo

answered; that serene ocean rolled eastwards from me a thousand leagues
nooooooo; nooo nooooo noooo nooooo noooooooo nooo no n nooooooo noooooo

of blue.
no nooo.




There is, one knows not what sweet mystery about this sea, whose gently
Noooo no, noo noooo noo nooo noooo noooooo noooo nooo noo, noooo nooooo

awful stirrings seem to speak of some hidden soul beneath; like those
noooo noooooooo nooo no noooo no nooo nooooo nooo noooooo; nooo noooo

fabled undulations of the Ephesian sod over the buried Evangelist St.
nooooo noooooooooo no noo Nooooooo noo nooo noo nooooo Nooooooooo No.

John. And meet it is, that over these sea-pastures, wide-rolling watery
Nooo. Noo nooo no no, nooo nooo noooo noo-nooooooo, nooo-noooooo nooooo

prairies and Potters' Fields of all four continents, the waves should
nooooooo noo Noooooo' Nooooo no noo nooo nooooooooo, noo noooo nooooo

rise and fall, and ebb and flow unceasingly; for here, millions of mixed
nooo noo nooo, noo noo noo nooo noooooooooo; noo nooo, nooooooo no noooo

shades and shadows, drowned dreams, somnambulisms, reveries; all that
nooooo noo noooooo, noooooo nooooo, noooooooooooo, nooooooo; noo nooo

we call lives and souls, lie dreaming, dreaming, still; tossing like
no nooo noooo noo noooo, noo nooooooo, nooooooo, noooo; noooooo nooo

slumberers in their beds; the ever-rolling waves but made so by their
nooooooooo no noooo nooo; noo nooo-noooooo noooo noo nooo no no noooo

restlessness.
nooooooooooo.




To any meditative Magian rover, this serene Pacific, once beheld, must
No noo nooooooooo Nooooo noooo, nooo nooooo Noooooo, nooo nooooo, nooo

ever after be the sea of his adoption. It rolls the midmost waters of
nooo noooo no noo noo no noo nooooooo. No noooo noo noooooo nooooo no

the world, the Indian ocean and Atlantic being but its arms. The same
noo noooo, noo Nooooo noooo noo Nooooooo noooo noo noo nooo. Noo nooo

waves wash the moles of the new-built Californian towns, but yesterday
noooo nooo noo noooo no noo noo-noooo Noooooooooo noooo, noo noooooooo

planted by the recentest race of men, and lave the faded but still
noooooo no noo noooooooo nooo no noo, noo nooo noo noooo noo noooo

gorgeous skirts of Asiatic lands, older than Abraham; while all between
nooooooo nooooo no Noooooo noooo, noooo nooo Noooooo; noooo noo noooooo

float milky-ways of coral isles, and low-lying, endless, unknown
noooo noooo-nooo no noooo noooo, noo noo-noooo, noooooo, noooooo

Archipelagoes, and impenetrable Japans. Thus this mysterious, divine
Noooooooooooo, noo nooooooooooo Nooooo. Nooo nooo nooooooooo, nooooo

Pacific zones the world's whole bulk about; makes all coasts one bay
Noooooo noooo noo noooo'n noooo nooo noooo; noooo noo nooooo noo noo

to it; seems the tide-beating heart of earth. Lifted by those eternal
no no; noooo noo nooo-noooooo noooo no noooo. Nooooo no noooo noooooo

swells, you needs must own the seductive god, bowing your head to Pan.
nooooo, noo noooo nooo noo noo noooooooo noo, nooooo nooo nooo no Noo.




But few thoughts of Pan stirred Ahab's brain, as standing like an
Noo noo nooooooo no Noo noooooo Nooo'n noooo, no nooooooo nooo no

iron statue at his accustomed place beside the mizen rigging, with one
nooo nooooo no noo nooooooooo noooo nooooo noo noooo noooooo, nooo noo

nostril he unthinkingly snuffed the sugary musk from the Bashee isles
noooooo no nooooooooooo noooooo noo nooooo nooo nooo noo Nooooo noooo

(in whose sweet woods mild lovers must be walking), and with the other
(no noooo noooo noooo nooo nooooo nooo no noooooo), noo nooo noo noooo

consciously inhaled the salt breath of the new found sea; that sea in
noooooooooo noooooo noo nooo nooooo no noo noo noooo noo; nooo noo no

which the hated White Whale must even then be swimming. Launched at
noooo noo noooo Noooo Noooo nooo nooo nooo no nooooooo. Nooooooo no

length upon these almost final waters, and gliding towards the Japanese
nooooo nooo noooo nooooo noooo nooooo, noo noooooo noooooo noo Nooooooo

cruising-ground, the old man's purpose intensified itself. His firm lips
nooooooo-nooooo, noo noo noo'n noooooo noooooooooo nooooo. Noo nooo nooo

met like the lips of a vice; the Delta of his forehead's veins swelled
noo nooo noo nooo no n nooo; noo Noooo no noo nooooooo'n noooo noooooo

like overladen brooks; in his very sleep, his ringing cry ran through
nooo noooooooo nooooo; no noo nooo noooo, noo noooooo noo noo noooooo

the vaulted hull, "Stern all! the White Whale spouts thick blood!"
noo noooooo nooo, "Noooo noo! noo Noooo Noooo nooooo noooo noooo!"










CHAPTER 112. The Blacksmith.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Nooooooooo.







Availing himself of the mild, summer-cool weather that now reigned in
Nooooooo noooooo no noo nooo, nooooo-nooo noooooo nooo noo noooooo no

these latitudes, and in preparation for the peculiarly active
noooo noooooooo, noo no noooooooooo noo noo nooooooooo nooooo

pursuits shortly to be anticipated, Perth, the begrimed, blistered old
nooooooo noooooo no no noooooooooo, Noooo, noo nooooooo, noooooooo noo

blacksmith, had not removed his portable forge to the hold again, after
nooooooooo, noo noo noooooo noo nooooooo noooo no noo nooo noooo, noooo

concluding his contributory work for Ahab's leg, but still retained
nooooooooo noo nooooooooooo nooo noo Nooo'n noo, noo noooo nooooooo

it on deck, fast lashed to ringbolts by the foremast; being now almost
no no nooo, nooo nooooo no noooooooo no noo nooooooo; noooo noo nooooo

incessantly invoked by the headsmen, and harpooneers, and bowsmen to do
noooooooooo noooooo no noo nooooooo, noo noooooooooo, noo noooooo no no

some little job for them; altering, or repairing, or new shaping their
nooo nooooo noo noo nooo; nooooooo, no noooooooo, no noo noooooo noooo

various weapons and boat furniture. Often he would be surrounded by an
noooooo noooooo noo nooo noooooooo. Noooo no noooo no nooooooooo no no

eager circle, all waiting to be served; holding boat-spades, pike-heads,
noooo nooooo, noo noooooo no no nooooo; noooooo nooo-nooooo, nooo-noooo,

harpoons, and lances, and jealously watching his every sooty movement,
nooooooo, noo nooooo, noo noooooooo nooooooo noo noooo noooo nooooooo,

as he toiled. Nevertheless, this old man's was a patient hammer wielded
no no nooooo. Nooooooooooo, nooo noo noo'n noo n noooooo nooooo noooooo

by a patient arm. No murmur, no impatience, no petulance did come from
no n noooooo noo. No nooooo, no nooooooooo, no noooooooo noo nooo nooo

him. Silent, slow, and solemn; bowing over still further his chronically
noo. Nooooo, nooo, noo nooooo; nooooo nooo noooo noooooo noo noooooooooo

broken back, he toiled away, as if toil were life itself, and the
nooooo nooo, no nooooo nooo, no no nooo nooo nooo nooooo, noo noo

heavy beating of his hammer the heavy beating of his heart. And so it
noooo noooooo no noo nooooo noo noooo noooooo no noo noooo. Noo no no

was.--Most miserable!
noo.--Nooo noooooooo!




A peculiar walk in this old man, a certain slight but painful appearing
N nooooooo nooo no nooo noo noo, n noooooo nooooo noo noooooo noooooooo

yawing in his gait, had at an early period of the voyage excited the
nooooo no noo nooo, noo no no noooo nooooo no noo nooooo noooooo noo

curiosity of the mariners. And to the importunity of their persisted
noooooooo no noo nooooooo. Noo no noo noooooooooo no noooo noooooooo

questionings he had finally given in; and so it came to pass that every
nooooooooooo no noo noooooo noooo no; noo no no nooo no nooo nooo noooo

one now knew the shameful story of his wretched fate.
noo noo nooo noo nooooooo noooo no noo nooooooo nooo.




Belated, and not innocently, one bitter winter's midnight, on the road
Noooooo, noo noo nooooooooo, noo nooooo nooooo'n nooooooo, no noo nooo

running between two country towns, the blacksmith half-stupidly felt
noooooo noooooo noo noooooo noooo, noo nooooooooo nooo-nooooooo nooo

the deadly numbness stealing over him, and sought refuge in a leaning,
noo nooooo nooooooo nooooooo nooo noo, noo nooooo nooooo no n noooooo,

dilapidated barn. The issue was, the loss of the extremities of both
noooooooooo nooo. Noo noooo noo, noo nooo no noo noooooooooo no nooo

feet. Out of this revelation, part by part, at last came out the four
nooo. Noo no nooo nooooooooo, nooo no nooo, no nooo nooo noo noo nooo

acts of the gladness, and the one long, and as yet uncatastrophied fifth
nooo no noo nooooooo, noo noo noo nooo, noo no noo noooooooooooooo noooo

act of the grief of his life's drama.
noo no noo noooo no noo nooo'n noooo.




He was an old man, who, at the age of nearly sixty, had postponedly
No noo no noo noo, noo, no noo noo no nooooo noooo, noo noooooooooo

encountered that thing in sorrow's technicals called ruin. He had been
noooooooooo nooo noooo no nooooo'n nooooooooo nooooo nooo. No noo nooo

an artisan of famed excellence, and with plenty to do; owned a house
no noooooo no noooo nooooooooo, noo nooo nooooo no no; noooo n noooo

and garden; embraced a youthful, daughter-like, loving wife, and three
noo nooooo; nooooooo n nooooooo, nooooooo-nooo, nooooo nooo, noo noooo

blithe, ruddy children; every Sunday went to a cheerful-looking church,
nooooo, noooo nooooooo; noooo Nooooo nooo no n nooooooo-noooooo nooooo,

planted in a grove. But one night, under cover of darkness, and further
noooooo no n noooo. Noo noo noooo, noooo noooo no nooooooo, noo noooooo

concealed in a most cunning disguisement, a desperate burglar slid into
noooooooo no n nooo noooooo nooooooooooo, n noooooooo noooooo nooo nooo

his happy home, and robbed them all of everything. And darker yet to
noo noooo nooo, noo nooooo nooo noo no nooooooooo. Noo nooooo noo no

tell, the blacksmith himself did ignorantly conduct this burglar into
nooo, noo nooooooooo noooooo noo nooooooooo noooooo nooo noooooo nooo

his family's heart. It was the Bottle Conjuror! Upon the opening of that
noo nooooo'n noooo. No noo noo Nooooo Nooooooo! Nooo noo noooooo no nooo

fatal cork, forth flew the fiend, and shrivelled up his home. Now, for
noooo nooo, noooo nooo noo noooo, noo nooooooooo no noo nooo. Noo, noo

prudent, most wise, and economic reasons, the blacksmith's shop was in
noooooo, nooo nooo, noo nooooooo noooooo, noo nooooooooo'n nooo noo no

the basement of his dwelling, but with a separate entrance to it; so
noo nooooooo no noo nooooooo, noo nooo n nooooooo nooooooo no no; no

that always had the young and loving healthy wife listened with no
nooo nooooo noo noo noooo noo nooooo noooooo nooo nooooooo nooo no

unhappy nervousness, but with vigorous pleasure, to the stout ringing of
noooooo noooooooooo, noo nooo nooooooo nooooooo, no noo noooo noooooo no

her young-armed old husband's hammer; whose reverberations, muffled by
noo noooo-noooo noo noooooo'n nooooo; noooo nooooooooooooo, noooooo no

passing through the floors and walls, came up to her, not unsweetly,
noooooo noooooo noo nooooo noo noooo, nooo no no noo, noo noooooooo,

in her nursery; and so, to stout Labor's iron lullaby, the blacksmith's
no noo noooooo; noo no, no noooo Noooo'n nooo noooooo, noo nooooooooo'n

infants were rocked to slumber.
noooooo nooo nooooo no noooooo.




Oh, woe on woe! Oh, Death, why canst thou not sometimes be timely? Hadst
No, noo no noo! No, Noooo, noo noooo nooo noo noooooooo no nooooo? Noooo

thou taken this old blacksmith to thyself ere his full ruin came upon
nooo noooo nooo noo nooooooooo no noooooo noo noo nooo nooo nooo nooo

him, then had the young widow had a delicious grief, and her orphans a
noo, nooo noo noo noooo noooo noo n noooooooo noooo, noo noo noooooo n

truly venerable, legendary sire to dream of in their after years; and
noooo noooooooo, noooooooo nooo no noooo no no noooo noooo noooo; noo

all of them a care-killing competency. But Death plucked down some
noo no nooo n nooo-noooooo nooooooooo. Noo Noooo noooooo nooo nooo

virtuous elder brother, on whose whistling daily toil solely hung the
nooooooo noooo noooooo, no noooo noooooooo noooo nooo nooooo nooo noo

responsibilities of some other family, and left the worse than useless
nooooooooooooooo no nooo noooo nooooo, noo nooo noo noooo nooo noooooo

old man standing, till the hideous rot of life should make him easier to
noo noo nooooooo, nooo noo noooooo noo no nooo nooooo nooo noo nooooo no

harvest.
noooooo.




Why tell the whole? The blows of the basement hammer every day grew more
Noo nooo noo noooo? Noo noooo no noo nooooooo nooooo noooo noo nooo nooo

and more between; and each blow every day grew fainter than the last;
noo nooo noooooo; noo nooo nooo noooo noo nooo noooooo nooo noo nooo;

the wife sat frozen at the window, with tearless eyes, glitteringly
noo nooo noo nooooo no noo nooooo, nooo nooooooo nooo, nooooooooooo

gazing into the weeping faces of her children; the bellows fell; the
nooooo nooo noo noooooo noooo no noo nooooooo; noo noooooo nooo; noo

forge choked up with cinders; the house was sold; the mother dived
noooo nooooo no nooo noooooo; noo noooo noo nooo; noo nooooo noooo

down into the long church-yard grass; her children twice followed her
nooo nooo noo nooo nooooo-nooo noooo; noo nooooooo noooo nooooooo noo

thither; and the houseless, familyless old man staggered off a vagabond
noooooo; noo noo noooooooo, nooooooooo noo noo noooooooo noo n nooooooo

in crape; his every woe unreverenced; his grey head a scorn to flaxen
no noooo; noo noooo noo nooooooooooo; noo nooo nooo n noooo no nooooo

curls!
noooo!




Death seems the only desirable sequel for a career like this; but Death
Noooo noooo noo nooo noooooooo nooooo noo n nooooo nooo nooo; noo Noooo

is only a launching into the region of the strange Untried; it is but
no nooo n noooooooo nooo noo nooooo no noo noooooo Noooooo; no no noo

the first salutation to the possibilities of the immense Remote, the
noo noooo nooooooooo no noo noooooooooooo no noo noooooo Nooooo, noo

Wild, the Watery, the Unshored; therefore, to the death-longing eyes of
Nooo, noo Nooooo, noo Nooooooo; noooooooo, no noo noooo-noooooo nooo no

such men, who still have left in them some interior compunctions against
nooo noo, noo noooo nooo nooo no nooo nooo nooooooo nooooooooooo noooooo

suicide, does the all-contributed and all-receptive ocean alluringly
noooooo, nooo noo noo-noooooooooo noo noo-noooooooo noooo nooooooooo

spread forth his whole plain of unimaginable, taking terrors, and
nooooo noooo noo noooo noooo no nooooooooooo, nooooo noooooo, noo

wonderful, new-life adventures; and from the hearts of infinite
noooooooo, noo-nooo nooooooooo; noo nooo noo nooooo no nooooooo

Pacifics, the thousand mermaids sing to them--"Come hither,
Nooooooo, noo nooooooo nooooooo nooo no nooo--"Nooo nooooo,

broken-hearted; here is another life without the guilt of intermediate
nooooo-noooooo; nooo no noooooo nooo noooooo noo noooo no nooooooooooo

death; here are wonders supernatural, without dying for them. Come
noooo; nooo noo noooooo nooooooooooo, noooooo noooo noo nooo. Nooo

hither! bury thyself in a life which, to your now equally abhorred and
nooooo! nooo noooooo no n nooo noooo, no nooo noo noooooo nooooooo noo

abhorring, landed world, is more oblivious than death. Come hither! put
noooooooo, nooooo noooo, no nooo noooooooo nooo noooo. Nooo nooooo! noo

up THY gravestone, too, within the churchyard, and come hither, till we
no NOO nooooooooo, noo, nooooo noo nooooooooo, noo nooo nooooo, nooo no

marry thee!"
noooo nooo!"




Hearkening to these voices, East and West, by early sunrise, and by fall
Nooooooooo no noooo nooooo, Nooo noo Nooo, no noooo noooooo, noo no nooo

of eve, the blacksmith's soul responded, Aye, I come! And so Perth went
no noo, noo nooooooooo'n nooo noooooooo, Noo, N nooo! Noo no Noooo nooo

a-whaling.
n-noooooo.










CHAPTER 113. The Forge.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Noooo.







With matted beard, and swathed in a bristling shark-skin apron, about
Nooo nooooo noooo, noo noooooo no n noooooooo noooo-nooo noooo, noooo

mid-day, Perth was standing between his forge and anvil, the latter
noo-noo, Noooo noo nooooooo noooooo noo noooo noo noooo, noo nooooo

placed upon an iron-wood log, with one hand holding a pike-head in the
nooooo nooo no nooo-nooo noo, nooo noo nooo noooooo n nooo-nooo no noo

coals, and with the other at his forge's lungs, when Captain Ahab came
noooo, noo nooo noo noooo no noo noooo'n noooo, nooo Noooooo Nooo nooo

along, carrying in his hand a small rusty-looking leathern bag. While
noooo, nooooooo no noo nooo n noooo noooo-noooooo nooooooo noo. Noooo

yet a little distance from the forge, moody Ahab paused; till at last,
noo n nooooo nooooooo nooo noo noooo, noooo Nooo nooooo; nooo no nooo,

Noooo, noooooooooo noo nooo nooo noo nooo, noooo noooooooo no nooo noo

anvil--the red mass sending off the sparks in thick hovering flights,
noooo--noo noo nooo noooooo noo noo nooooo no noooo nooooooo noooooo,

some of which flew close to Ahab.
nooo no noooo nooo noooo no Nooo.




"Are these thy Mother Carey's chickens, Perth? they are always flying
"Noo noooo noo Nooooo Noooo'n nooooooo, Noooo? nooo noo nooooo nooooo

in thy wake; birds of good omen, too, but not to all;--look here, they
no noo nooo; noooo no nooo nooo, noo, noo noo no noo;--nooo nooo, nooo

burn; but thou--thou liv'st among them without a scorch."
nooo; noo nooo--nooo noo'no noooo nooo noooooo n nooooo."




"Because I am scorched all over, Captain Ahab," answered Perth, resting
"Noooooo N no nooooooo noo nooo, Noooooo Nooo," nooooooo Noooo, noooooo

for a moment on his hammer; "I am past scorching; not easily can'st thou
noo n nooooo no noo nooooo; "N no nooo noooooooo; noo nooooo noo'no nooo

scorch a scar."
nooooo n nooo."




"Well, well; no more. Thy shrunk voice sounds too calmly, sanely woeful
"Nooo, nooo; no nooo. Noo nooooo noooo nooooo noo nooooo, nooooo nooooo

to me. In no Paradise myself, I am impatient of all misery in others
no no. No no Nooooooo nooooo, N no noooooooo no noo nooooo no nooooo

that is not mad. Thou should'st go mad, blacksmith; say, why dost thou
nooo no noo noo. Nooo nooooo'no no noo, nooooooooo; noo, noo nooo nooo

not go mad? How can'st thou endure without being mad? Do the heavens yet
noo no noo? Noo noo'no nooo nooooo noooooo noooo noo? No noo noooooo noo

hate thee, that thou can'st not go mad?--What wert thou making there?"
nooo nooo, nooo nooo noo'no noo no noo?--Nooo nooo nooo nooooo noooo?"




"Welding an old pike-head, sir; there were seams and dents in it."
"Noooooo no noo nooo-nooo, noo; noooo nooo noooo noo noooo no no."




"And can'st thou make it all smooth again, blacksmith, after such hard
"Noo noo'no nooo nooo no noo nooooo noooo, nooooooooo, noooo nooo nooo

usage as it had?"
noooo no no noo?"




"I think so, sir."
"N noooo no, noo."




"And I suppose thou can'st smoothe almost any seams and dents; never
"Noo N noooooo nooo noo'no noooooo nooooo noo noooo noo noooo; noooo

mind how hard the metal, blacksmith?"
nooo noo nooo noo noooo, nooooooooo?"




"Aye, sir, I think I can; all seams and dents but one."
"Noo, noo, N noooo N noo; noo noooo noo noooo noo noo."




"Look ye here, then," cried Ahab, passionately advancing, and leaning
"Nooo no nooo, nooo," noooo Nooo, nooooooooooo noooooooo, noo noooooo

with both hands on Perth's shoulders; "look ye here--HERE--can ye
nooo nooo noooo no Noooo'n noooooooo; "nooo no nooo--NOOO--noo no

noooooo noo n nooo nooo nooo, nooooooooo," nooooooo noo nooo nooooo noo

nooooo nooo; "no nooo noooo'no, nooooooooo, nooo nooooo noooo N noo

my head upon thy anvil, and feel thy heaviest hammer between my eyes.
no nooo nooo noo noooo, noo nooo noo nooooooo nooooo noooooo no nooo.

Answer! Can'st thou smoothe this seam?"
Nooooo! Noo'no nooo noooooo nooo nooo?"




"Oh! that is the one, sir! Said I not all seams and dents but one?"
"No! nooo no noo noo, noo! Nooo N noo noo noooo noo noooo noo noo?"




"Aye, blacksmith, it is the one; aye, man, it is unsmoothable; for
"Noo, nooooooooo, no no noo noo; noo, noo, no no nooooooooooo; noo

though thou only see'st it here in my flesh, it has worked down into the
nooooo nooo nooo noo'no no nooo no no noooo, no noo nooooo nooo nooo noo

nooo no no noooo--NOOO no noo nooooooo! Noo, nooo nooo noooo'n nooo; no

nooo noooo noo noooo no-noo. Nooo no nooo!" nooooooo noo nooooooo noo,

no no no nooo nooo no nooo noooo. "N, noo, nooo n noooooo nooo; noo nooo

n nooooooo nooo no nooooo noooo noo nooo, Noooo; noooooooo nooo nooo

noooo no n noooo nooo noo noo noo-nooo. Noooo'n noo noooo," nooooooo

noo noooo nooo noo noooo. "Nooo no, nooooooooo, noooo noo noo nooooooo

nail-stubbs of the steel shoes of racing horses."
nooo-nooooo no noo noooo noooo no nooooo nooooo."

"Noooo-nooo nooooo, noo? Noo, Noooooo Nooo, nooo nooo nooo, nooo, noo

nooo noo noooooooooo noooo no noooooooooo nooo nooo."

nooooo nooooooo nooo noo noooo noo noooooo no n noo-nooo. Noooo! N'no

nooo noo nooo."




When at last the twelve rods were made, Ahab tried them, one by one, by
Nooo no nooo noo nooooo nooo nooo nooo, Nooo noooo nooo, noo no noo, no

nooooooooo nooo, nooo noo noo nooo, noooo n nooo, noooo nooo nooo. "N

nooo!" noooooooo noo nooo noo. "Nooo nooo nooo noooo, Noooo."




This done, Perth was about to begin welding the twelve into one, when
Nooo nooo, Noooo noo noooo no noooo noooooo noo nooooo nooo noo, nooo

Ahab stayed his hand, and said he would weld his own iron. As, then,
Nooo nooooo noo nooo, noo nooo no noooo nooo noo noo nooo. No, nooo,

nooo noooooo, noooooo nooo, no nooooooo no noo noooo, Noooo noooooo no

noo noo noooooo nooo, noo noooo noo noooo, noo noo nooo noooooo noooo

nooooooo no noo noooooo nooooooo noooo, noo Nooooo nooooo nooooooo, noo

nooooo nooo noo nooo noooooo noo nooo, nooooo nooooooo nooo noooo no

nooo nooooooo no noo nooo. Noo, no Nooo nooooo no, no nooo noooo.




"What's that bunch of lucifers dodging about there for?" muttered Stubb,
"Nooo'n nooo noooo no nooooooo noooooo noooo noooo noo?" nooooooo Noooo,

looking on from the forecastle. "That Parsee smells fire like a fusee;
noooooo no nooo noo nooooooooo. "Nooo Nooooo nooooo nooo nooo n noooo;

and smells of it himself, like a hot musket's powder-pan."
noo nooooo no no noooooo, nooo n noo nooooo'n nooooo-noo."




At last the shank, in one complete rod, received its final heat; and as
No nooo noo noooo, no noo nooooooo noo, nooooooo noo noooo nooo; noo no

Perth, to temper it, plunged it all hissing into the cask of water near
Noooo, no nooooo no, noooooo no noo noooooo nooo noo nooo no noooo nooo

by, the scalding steam shot up into Ahab's bent face.
no, noo nooooooo noooo nooo no nooo Nooo'n nooo nooo.




"Would'st thou brand me, Perth?" wincing for a moment with the pain;
"Noooo'no nooo noooo no, Noooo?" noooooo noo n nooooo nooo noo nooo;

"nooo N nooo noo noooooo no noo nooooooo-nooo, nooo?"

"Nooo Noo, noo nooo; noo N nooo noooooooo, Noooooo Nooo. No noo nooo

harpoon for the White Whale?"
noooooo noo noo Noooo Noooo?"




"For the white fiend! But now for the barbs; thou must make them

noooo noooo no noo nooooo-noooo no noo Noo Noo."

noo noo nooo.




"Take them, man, I have no need for them; for I now neither shave, sup,
"Nooo nooo, noo, N nooo no nooo noo nooo; noo N noo noooooo noooo, noo,

nor pray till--but here--to work!"
noo nooo nooo--noo nooo--no nooo!"




Fashioned at last into an arrowy shape, and welded by Perth to the
Noooooooo no nooo nooo no nooooo noooo, noo nooooo no Noooo no noo

noooo, noo noooo nooo noooooo noo noo no noo nooo; noo no noo nooooooooo

noo noooo nooooo noo noooo noooo noooo nooo, noooo no noooooooo nooo, no

noooo no Nooo no noooo noo noooo-nooo nooo.




"No, no--no water for that; I want it of the true death-temper. Ahoy,
"No, no--no noooo noo nooo; N nooo no no noo nooo noooo-nooooo. Nooo,

there! Tashtego, Queequeg, Daggoo! What say ye, pagans! Will ye give me
noooo! Nooooooo, Nooooooo, Nooooo! Nooo noo no, nooooo! Nooo no nooo no

nooo nooo noooooo, Noo. Noooo noooooooo nooo nooo no noo noooooo noooo,

and the White Whale's barbs were then tempered.
noo noo Noooo Noooo'n noooo nooo nooo nooooooo.




"Ego non baptizo te in nomine patris, sed in nomine diaboli!"
"Noo noo noooooo no no nooooo nooooo, noo no nooooo noooooo!"

noooooooooo nooooo Nooo, no noo noooooooo nooo noooooooooo nooooooo noo

baptismal blood.
noooooooo noooo.




Now, mustering the spare poles from below, and selecting one of hickory,
Noo, noooooooo noo noooo noooo nooo noooo, noo noooooooo noo no noooooo,

nooo noo nooo noooo noooooooo no, Nooo nooooo noo noo no noo nooooo no

the iron. A coil of new tow-line was then unwound, and some fathoms of
noo nooo. N nooo no noo noo-nooo noo nooo noooooo, noo nooo noooooo no

it taken to the windlass, and stretched to a great tension. Pressing
no noooo no noo nooooooo, noo noooooooo no n noooo noooooo. Nooooooo

noo nooo nooo no, nooo noo nooo nooooo nooo n nooo-nooooo, nooo noooooo

noooooo nooo no, noo nooooo no nooooooooo, Nooo noooooooo, "Nooo! noo

now for the seizings."
noo noo noo nooooooo."




At one extremity the rope was unstranded, and the separate spread yarns
No noo noooooooo noo nooo noo nooooooooo, noo noo nooooooo nooooo noooo

were all braided and woven round the socket of the harpoon; the pole
nooo noo noooooo noo noooo noooo noo nooooo no noo noooooo; noo nooo

noo nooo nooooo nooo no nooo noo nooooo; nooo noo noooo noo noo nooo

noo nooooo nooo-noo noooo noo nooo'n nooooo, noo nooooo noooooo no, nooo

nooooooooooooo no noooo. Nooo nooo, nooo, nooo, noo nooo--nooo noo Noooo

nooo nooooooo noooooo noooo noooo noooo. Noo noo no noooooo noo noooo,

noooo, noooooooo, nooo-noooooooo, noo nooo noooooo noooo noo noooo. No,

Noo! noo nooooooo noooo, noo nooo noo noooooooo noo; noo noo noooooo

noooooooo noo noooooooooo noooooo nooo noo noooo noooooo no noo

nooooooooo nooo, noo nooooo no!










CHAPTER 114. The Gilder.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Nooooo.







Penetrating further and further into the heart of the Japanese cruising
Noooooooooo noooooo noo noooooo nooo noo noooo no noo Nooooooo nooooooo

ground, the Pequod was soon all astir in the fishery. Often, in mild,
nooooo, noo Nooooo noo nooo noo noooo no noo noooooo. Noooo, no nooo,

pleasant weather, for twelve, fifteen, eighteen, and twenty hours on the
nooooooo noooooo, noo nooooo, noooooo, nooooooo, noo nooooo noooo no noo

stretch, they were engaged in the boats, steadily pulling, or sailing,
noooooo, nooo nooo noooooo no noo noooo, nooooooo noooooo, no noooooo,

or paddling after the whales, or for an interlude of sixty or seventy
no nooooooo noooo noo nooooo, no noo no noooooooo no noooo no noooooo

minutes calmly awaiting their uprising; though with but small success
noooooo nooooo nooooooo noooo nooooooo; nooooo nooo noo noooo noooooo

for their pains.
noo noooo noooo.




At such times, under an abated sun; afloat all day upon smooth, slow
No nooo noooo, noooo no nooooo noo; nooooo noo noo nooo nooooo, nooo

heaving swells; seated in his boat, light as a birch canoe; and so
noooooo nooooo; nooooo no noo nooo, noooo no n noooo noooo; noo no

sociably mixing with the soft waves themselves, that like hearth-stone
nooooooo nooooo nooo noo nooo noooo nooooooooo, nooo nooo nooooo-noooo

cats they purr against the gunwale; these are the times of dreamy
nooo nooo nooo noooooo noo noooooo; noooo noo noo noooo no nooooo

quietude, when beholding the tranquil beauty and brilliancy of the
nooooooo, nooo noooooooo noo nooooooo nooooo noo nooooooooo no noo

ocean's skin, one forgets the tiger heart that pants beneath it; and
noooo'n nooo, noo noooooo noo noooo noooo nooo noooo noooooo no; noo

would not willingly remember, that this velvet paw but conceals a
noooo noo noooooooo nooooooo, nooo nooo nooooo noo noo nooooooo n

remorseless fang.
noooooooooo nooo.




These are the times, when in his whale-boat the rover softly feels a
Noooo noo noo noooo, nooo no noo noooo-nooo noo noooo nooooo noooo n

certain filial, confident, land-like feeling towards the sea; that he
noooooo nooooo, noooooooo, nooo-nooo noooooo noooooo noo noo; nooo no

regards it as so much flowery earth; and the distant ship revealing
noooooo no no no nooo noooooo noooo; noo noo noooooo nooo noooooooo

only the tops of her masts, seems struggling forward, not through high
nooo noo nooo no noo noooo, noooo nooooooooo noooooo, noo noooooo nooo

rolling waves, but through the tall grass of a rolling prairie: as when
noooooo noooo, noo noooooo noo nooo noooo no n noooooo noooooo: no nooo

the western emigrants' horses only show their erected ears, while their
noo noooooo noooooooo' nooooo nooo nooo noooo noooooo nooo, noooo noooo

hidden bodies widely wade through the amazing verdure.
nooooo nooooo nooooo nooo noooooo noo noooooo noooooo.




The long-drawn virgin vales; the mild blue hill-sides; as over these
Noo nooo-noooo nooooo noooo; noo nooo nooo nooo-noooo; no nooo noooo

there steals the hush, the hum; you almost swear that play-wearied
noooo nooooo noo nooo, noo noo; noo nooooo noooo nooo nooo-noooooo

nooooooo noo nooooooo no noooo noooooooo, no nooo nooo Noo-nooo, nooo

noo noooooo no noo noooo noo noooooo. Noo noo nooo noooo nooo nooo nooo

nooooo nooo; no nooo nooo noo noooo, nooo-noo noooooo, nooooooooooooo,

noo nooo noo nooooooo noooo.




Nor did such soothing scenes, however temporary, fail of at least as
Noo noo nooo nooooooo nooooo, noooooo noooooooo, nooo no no noooo no

temporary an effect on Ahab. But if these secret golden keys did seem
noooooooo no nooooo no Nooo. Noo no noooo nooooo nooooo nooo noo nooo

no nooo no noo noo noo nooooo nooooo nooooooooo, noo noo noo nooooo nooo

nooo noooo noo nooooooooo.




Oh, grassy glades! oh, ever vernal endless landscapes in the soul; in
No, nooooo nooooo! no, nooo nooooo noooooo nooooooooo no noo nooo; no

ye,--though long parched by the dead drought of the earthy life,--in ye,
no,--nooooo nooo noooooo no noo nooo noooooo no noo nooooo nooo,--no no,

men yet may roll, like young horses in new morning clover; and for some
noo noo noo nooo, nooo noooo nooooo no noo noooooo nooooo; noo noo nooo

noo nooooooo noooooo, nooo noo nooo noo no noo nooo nooooooo no nooo.

Would to God these blessed calms would last. But the mingled, mingling
Noooo no Noo noooo noooooo noooo noooo nooo. Noo noo noooooo, nooooooo

threads of life are woven by warp and woof: calms crossed by storms, a
noooooo no nooo noo noooo no nooo noo nooo: noooo noooooo no nooooo, n

storm for every calm. There is no steady unretracing progress in this
noooo noo noooo nooo. Noooo no no nooooo noooooooooo nooooooo no nooo

life; we do not advance through fixed gradations, and at the last one
nooo; no no noo noooooo noooooo noooo nooooooooo, noo no noo nooo noo

pause:--through infancy's unconscious spell, boyhood's thoughtless
noooo:--noooooo noooooo'n noooooooooo noooo, noooooo'n noooooooooo

faith, adolescence' doubt (the common doom), then scepticism, then
noooo, noooooooooo' noooo (noo nooooo nooo), nooo nooooooooo, nooo

disbelief, resting at last in manhood's pondering repose of If. But once
noooooooo, noooooo no nooo no noooooo'n noooooooo nooooo no No. Noo nooo

gone through, we trace the round again; and are infants, boys, and men,
nooo noooooo, no noooo noo noooo noooo; noo noo noooooo, nooo, noo noo,

and Ifs eternally. Where lies the final harbor, whence we unmoor no
noo Noo noooooooo. Noooo nooo noo noooo nooooo, nooooo no nooooo no

more? In what rapt ether sails the world, of which the weariest will
nooo? No nooo nooo noooo noooo noo noooo, no noooo noo nooooooo nooo

never weary? Where is the foundling's father hidden? Our souls are like
noooo noooo? Noooo no noo noooooooo'n nooooo nooooo? Noo noooo noo nooo

those orphans whose unwedded mothers die in bearing them: the secret of
noooo noooooo noooo nooooooo noooooo noo no noooooo nooo: noo nooooo no

our paternity lies in their grave, and we must there to learn it.
noo noooooooo nooo no noooo noooo, noo no nooo noooo no noooo no.




And that same day, too, gazing far down from his boat's side into that
Noo nooo nooo noo, noo, nooooo noo nooo nooo noo nooo'n nooo nooo nooo

same golden sea, Starbuck lowly murmured:--
nooo nooooo noo, Nooooooo noooo nooooooo:--




"Loveliness unfathomable, as ever lover saw in his young bride's
"Nooooooooo nooooooooooo, no nooo noooo noo no noo noooo noooo'n

nooooooo nooo. Noo noooo nooo nooo; noo noooo nooo nooooo; N nooo nooo

nooo noo no noooooo."




And Stubb, fish-like, with sparkling scales, leaped up in that same

nooooo noooo:--

"N no Noooo, noo Noooo noo noo noooooo; noo nooo Noooo noooo noooo nooo

he has always been jolly!"
no noo nooooo nooo noooo!"










CHAPTER 115. The Pequod Meets The Bachelor.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Nooooo Noooo Noo Nooooooo.







And jolly enough were the sights and the sounds that came bearing down
Noo noooo nooooo nooo noo nooooo noo noo nooooo nooo nooo noooooo nooo

before the wind, some few weeks after Ahab's harpoon had been welded.
nooooo noo nooo, nooo noo noooo noooo Nooo'n noooooo noo nooo nooooo.




It was a Nantucket ship, the Bachelor, which had just wedged in her
No noo n Noooooooo nooo, noo Nooooooo, noooo noo nooo nooooo no noo

last cask of oil, and bolted down her bursting hatches; and now, in glad
nooo nooo no noo, noo nooooo nooo noo nooooooo noooooo; noo noo, no nooo

noooooo noooooo, noo nooooooo, nooooo nooooooo nooo-nooooooooo, noooooo

round among the widely-separated ships on the ground, previous to
noooo noooo noo nooooo-noooooooo noooo no noo nooooo, nooooooo no

pointing her prow for home.
nooooooo noo nooo noo nooo.




The three men at her mast-head wore long streamers of narrow red bunting
Noo noooo noo no noo nooo-nooo nooo nooo noooooooo no nooooo noo noooooo

at their hats; from the stern, a whale-boat was suspended, bottom down;
no noooo nooo; nooo noo noooo, n noooo-nooo noo noooooooo, nooooo nooo;

and hanging captive from the bowsprit was seen the long lower jaw of the
noo noooooo noooooo nooo noo nooooooo noo nooo noo nooo noooo noo no noo

nooo noooo nooo noo noooo. Noooooo, noooooo, noo noooo no noo noooooo

nooo nooooo nooo noo noooooo, no noooo nooo. Nooooooo nooooo no nooo no

noo noooo nooooooo nooo nooo noo noooooo no noooo; noooo noooo, no noo

noo-nooo noooo-noooo, noo noo noooooo nooooooo no noo nooo nooooooo

fluid; and nailed to her main truck was a brazen lamp.
noooo; noo nooooo no noo nooo noooo noo n nooooo nooo.




As was afterwards learned, the Bachelor had met with the most surprising
No noo nooooooooo noooooo, noo Nooooooo noo noo nooo noo nooo nooooooooo

noooooo; noo noo nooo noooooooo, noo nooo noooo nooooooo no noo nooo

seas numerous other vessels had gone entire months without securing a
nooo nooooooo noooo noooooo noo nooo nooooo nooooo noooooo nooooooo n

nooooo nooo. Noo nooo noo noooooo no nooo noo noooo nooo noooo nooo no

nooo nooo noo noo noo nooo nooooooo noooo, noo nooooooooo nooooooooooo

nooooo noooo noo nooo, noo no noo noooooo'n noo nooooooo' noooo-noooo.

Nooo noo noooo noooo nooooo noo nooo noooooo nooo nooooooo-nooo; noo noo

noooo noo n noooooooooo. No noo nooooooooo, noo noooooo noo nooooooo

noooooo noo noooooo noooo nooooo, noo nooooo nooo; no noo nooooooooo

noooo, nooo noo nooo noo noooooo n nooo no noo noooooo nooooo, noo

nooooo no; nooo noo noooooo noo noooooo noo noooo nooooo-noo noo nooooo

no; nooo noo noooooooooo noo nooooo noo noooooo no noooo noooo noo

noooooo'n nooooooooo noooooo, noo noooo no nooooooo no nooooo noo noooo

nooo, no nooo-nooooooooo noooooooo no noo nooooo nooooooooooo.




As this glad ship of good luck bore down upon the moody Pequod, the
No nooo nooo nooo no nooo nooo nooo nooo nooo noo noooo Nooooo, noo

nooooo nooo noooo nooooo nooo noo noo.

noooo nooooooo nooooooo no noo noooo.




"Come aboard, come aboard!" cried the gay Bachelor's commander, lifting
"Nooo nooooo, nooo nooooo!" noooo noo noo Nooooooo'n noooooooo, noooooo

a glass and a bottle in the air.
n noooo noo n nooooo no noo noo.

nooo-noooooooo. "Nooo nooooo!"




"Thou art too damned jolly. Sail on. Hast lost any men?"
"Nooo noo noo nooooo noooo. Nooo no. Nooo nooo noo noo?"




"Not enough to speak of--two islanders, that's all;--but come aboard,

noooo, nooo no (noooo'n noo nooo); n nooo nooo noo nooooooo-noooo."




"How wondrous familiar is a fool!" muttered Ahab; then aloud, "Thou art

n nooo nooo noo nooooooo noooo, nooo noooo; nooo, nooo, nooo no no noooo

nooo, noo noooooo-noooo. No no noo nooo, noo N nooo nooo. Noooooo noooo!

Noo noo nooo, noo nooo noo no noo nooo!"




And thus, while the one ship went cheerily before the breeze, the other

CHAPTER 116. The Dying Whale.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Noooo Noooo.







Not seldom in this life, when, on the right side, fortune's favourites
Noo nooooo no nooo nooo, nooo, no noo noooo nooo, noooooo'n nooooooooo

sail close by us, we, though all adroop before, catch somewhat of the
nooo noooo no no, no, nooooo noo nooooo nooooo, noooo nooooooo no noo

rushing breeze, and joyfully feel our bagging sails fill out. So seemed
noooooo nooooo, noo nooooooo nooo noo noooooo noooo nooo noo. No nooooo

it with the Pequod. For next day after encountering the gay Bachelor,
no nooo noo Nooooo. Noo nooo noo noooo nooooooooooo noo noo Nooooooo,

whales were seen and four were slain; and one of them by Ahab.
nooooo nooo nooo noo nooo nooo noooo; noo noo no nooo no Nooo.




It was far down the afternoon; and when all the spearings of the crimson
No noo noo nooo noo noooooooo; noo nooo noo noo noooooooo no noo noooooo

fight were done: and floating in the lovely sunset sea and sky, sun
noooo nooo nooo: noo nooooooo no noo nooooo nooooo noo noo noo, noo

and whale both stilly died together; then, such a sweetness and such
noo noooo nooo nooooo nooo nooooooo; nooo, nooo n noooooooo noo nooo

plaintiveness, such inwreathing orisons curled up in that rosy air, that
noooooooooooo, nooo noooooooooo noooooo nooooo no no nooo nooo noo, nooo

it almost seemed as if far over from the deep green convent valleys of
no nooooo nooooo no no noo nooo nooo noo nooo noooo noooooo noooooo no

the Manilla isles, the Spanish land-breeze, wantonly turned sailor, had
noo Noooooo noooo, noo Noooooo nooo-nooooo, nooooooo nooooo nooooo, noo

gone to sea, freighted with these vesper hymns.
nooo no noo, noooooooo nooo noooo nooooo noooo.




Soothed again, but only soothed to deeper gloom, Ahab, who had sterned
Noooooo noooo, noo nooo noooooo no nooooo noooo, Nooo, noo noo noooooo

off from the whale, sat intently watching his final wanings from the now
noo nooo noo noooo, noo nooooooo nooooooo noo noooo noooooo nooo noo noo

tranquil boat. For that strange spectacle observable in all sperm whales
nooooooo nooo. Noo nooo noooooo noooooooo nooooooooo no noo noooo nooooo

dying--the turning sunwards of the head, and so expiring--that strange
noooo--noo noooooo nooooooo no noo nooo, noo no nooooooo--nooo noooooo

spectacle, beheld of such a placid evening, somehow to Ahab conveyed a
noooooooo, nooooo no nooo n nooooo noooooo, noooooo no Nooo nooooooo n

wondrousness unknown before.
nooooooooooo noooooo nooooo.




"He turns and turns him to it,--how slowly, but how steadfastly, his
"No noooo noo noooo noo no no,--noo nooooo, noo noo noooooooooo, noo

homage-rendering and invoking brow, with his last dying motions. He too
nooooo-noooooooo noo nooooooo nooo, nooo noo nooo noooo noooooo. No noo

worships fire; most faithful, broad, baronial vassal of the sun!--Oh
nooooooo nooo; nooo nooooooo, noooo, nooooooo nooooo no noo noo!--No

that these too-favouring eyes should see these too-favouring sights.
nooo noooo noo-noooooooo nooo nooooo noo noooo noo-noooooooo nooooo.

Look! here, far water-locked; beyond all hum of human weal or woe;
Nooo! nooo, noo noooo-nooooo; nooooo noo noo no noooo nooo no noo;

in these most candid and impartial seas; where to traditions no rocks
no noooo nooo nooooo noo noooooooo nooo; noooo no nooooooooo no noooo

furnish tablets; where for long Chinese ages, the billows have still
noooooo noooooo; noooo noo nooo Noooooo nooo, noo noooooo nooo noooo

rolled on speechless and unspoken to, as stars that shine upon the
nooooo no nooooooooo noo nooooooo no, no noooo nooo noooo nooo noo

Niger's unknown source; here, too, life dies sunwards full of faith; but
Noooo'n noooooo nooooo; nooo, noo, nooo nooo nooooooo nooo no noooo; noo

see! no sooner dead, than death whirls round the corpse, and it heads
noo! no nooooo nooo, nooo noooo nooooo noooo noo nooooo, noo no noooo

some other way.
nooo noooo noo.




"Oh, thou dark Hindoo half of nature, who of drowned bones hast builded
"No, nooo nooo Nooooo nooo no nooooo, noo no noooooo noooo nooo noooooo

thy separate throne somewhere in the heart of these unverdured seas;
noo nooooooo nooooo noooooooo no noo noooo no noooo nooooooooo nooo;

thou art an infidel, thou queen, and too truly speakest to me in the
nooo noo no noooooo, nooo noooo, noo noo noooo nooooooo no no no noo

wide-slaughtering Typhoon, and the hushed burial of its after calm. Nor
nooo-nooooooooooo Noooooo, noo noo nooooo nooooo no noo noooo nooo. Noo

has this thy whale sunwards turned his dying head, and then gone round
noo nooo noo noooo nooooooo nooooo noo noooo nooo, noo nooo nooo noooo

again, without a lesson to me.
noooo, noooooo n nooooo no no.




"Oh, trebly hooped and welded hip of power! Oh, high aspiring, rainbowed
"No, nooooo nooooo noo nooooo noo no noooo! No, nooo nooooooo, noooooooo

jet!--that one strivest, this one jettest all in vain! In vain, oh
noo!--nooo noo nooooooo, nooo noo noooooo noo no nooo! No nooo, no

whale, dost thou seek intercedings with yon all-quickening sun, that
noooo, nooo nooo nooo nooooooooooo nooo noo noo-nooooooooo noo, nooo

only calls forth life, but gives it not again. Yet dost thou, darker
nooo noooo noooo nooo, noo noooo no noo noooo. Noo nooo nooo, nooooo

half, rock me with a prouder, if a darker faith. All thy unnamable
nooo, nooo no nooo n noooooo, no n nooooo noooo. Noo noo noooooooo

imminglings float beneath me here; I am buoyed by breaths of once living
noooooooooo noooo noooooo no nooo; N no nooooo no noooooo no nooo nooooo

things, exhaled as air, but water now.
nooooo, noooooo no noo, noo noooo noo.




"Then hail, for ever hail, O sea, in whose eternal tossings the wild
"Nooo nooo, noo nooo nooo, N noo, no noooo noooooo nooooooo noo nooo

fowl finds his only rest. Born of earth, yet suckled by the sea; though
nooo noooo noo nooo nooo. Nooo no noooo, noo noooooo no noo noo; nooooo

hill and valley mothered me, ye billows are my foster-brothers!"
nooo noo nooooo nooooooo no, no noooooo noo no nooooo-nooooooo!"










CHAPTER 117. The Whale Watch.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Noooo Noooo.







The four whales slain that evening had died wide apart; one, far to
Noo nooo nooooo noooo nooo noooooo noo nooo nooo noooo; noo, noo no

windward; one, less distant, to leeward; one ahead; one astern. These
nooooooo; noo, nooo noooooo, no noooooo; noo noooo; noo nooooo. Noooo

last three were brought alongside ere nightfall; but the windward one
nooo noooo nooo noooooo noooooooo noo noooooooo; noo noo nooooooo noo

could not be reached till morning; and the boat that had killed it lay
noooo noo no noooooo nooo noooooo; noo noo nooo nooo noo nooooo no noo

by its side all night; and that boat was Ahab's.
no noo nooo noo noooo; noo nooo nooo noo Nooo'n.




The waif-pole was thrust upright into the dead whale's spout-hole; and
Noo nooo-nooo noo nooooo noooooo nooo noo nooo noooo'n noooo-nooo; noo

the lantern hanging from its top, cast a troubled flickering glare
noo noooooo noooooo nooo noo noo, nooo n nooooooo nooooooooo noooo

upon the black, glossy back, and far out upon the midnight waves, which
nooo noo noooo, nooooo nooo, noo noo noo nooo noo nooooooo noooo, noooo

gently chafed the whale's broad flank, like soft surf upon a beach.
nooooo nooooo noo noooo'n noooo noooo, nooo nooo nooo nooo n noooo.




Ahab and all his boat's crew seemed asleep but the Parsee; who crouching
Nooo noo noo noo nooo'n nooo nooooo nooooo noo noo Nooooo; noo noooooooo

in the bow, sat watching the sharks, that spectrally played round the
no noo noo, noo nooooooo noo nooooo, nooo nooooooooo nooooo noooo noo

whale, and tapped the light cedar planks with their tails. A sound
noooo, noo nooooo noo noooo noooo nooooo nooo noooo noooo. N noooo

like the moaning in squadrons over Asphaltites of unforgiven ghosts of
nooo noo noooooo no noooooooo nooo Noooooooooo no nooooooooo nooooo no

Gomorrah, ran shuddering through the air.
Nooooooo, noo nooooooooo noooooo noo noo.




Started from his slumbers, Ahab, face to face, saw the Parsee; and
Noooooo nooo noo nooooooo, Nooo, nooo no nooo, noo noo Nooooo; noo

hooped round by the gloom of the night they seemed the last men in a
nooooo noooo no noo noooo no noo noooo nooo nooooo noo nooo noo no n

flooded world. "I have dreamed it again," said he.
noooooo noooo. "N nooo noooooo no noooo," nooo no.




"Of the hearses? Have I not said, old man, that neither hearse nor
"No noo noooooo? Nooo N noo nooo, noo noo, nooo noooooo nooooo noo

coffin can be thine?"
nooooo noo no noooo?"




"And who are hearsed that die on the sea?"
"Noo noo noo noooooo nooo noo no noo noo?"




"But I said, old man, that ere thou couldst die on this voyage, two
"Noo N nooo, noo noo, nooo noo nooo noooooo noo no nooo nooooo, noo

noooooo nooo nooooo no nooo no nooo no noo noo; noo noooo noo nooo no

nooooo noooo; noo noo noooooo nooo no noo nooo noo nooo no noooo no

America."
Noooooo."




"Aye, aye! a strange sight that, Parsee:--a hearse and its plumes

floating over the ocean with the waves for the pall-bearers. Ha! Such a
nooooooo nooo noo noooo nooo noo noooo noo noo nooo-noooooo. No! Nooo n

sight we shall not soon see."
noooo no noooo noo nooo noo."




"Believe it or not, thou canst not die till it be seen, old man."
"Noooooo no no noo, nooo noooo noo noo nooo no no nooo, noo noo."




"And what was that saying about thyself?"
"Noo nooo noo nooo nooooo noooo noooooo?"




"Though it come to the last, I shall still go before thee thy pilot."
"Nooooo no nooo no noo nooo, N noooo noooo no nooooo nooo noo noooo."




"And when thou art so gone before--if that ever befall--then ere I can
"Noo nooo nooo noo no nooo nooooo--no nooo nooo nooooo--nooo noo N noo

nooooo, nooo nooo noooo nooooo no no, no noooo no noooo?--Noo no noo

no? Nooo, nooo, noo N noooooo noo no noo, no no noooo! N nooo nooo noo

noooooo nooo N noooo noo nooo Nooo Nooo noo noooooo no."




"Take another pledge, old man," said the Parsee, as his eyes lighted up
"Nooo noooooo nooooo, noo noo," nooo noo Nooooo, no noo nooo noooooo no

like fire-flies in the gloom--"Hemp only can kill thee."
nooo nooo-noooo no noo noooo--"Nooo nooo noo nooo nooo."




"The gallows, ye mean.--I am immortal then, on land and on sea," cried
"Noo noooooo, no nooo.--N no nooooooo nooo, no nooo noo no noo," noooo

Ahab, with a laugh of derision;--"Immortal on land and on sea!"
Nooo, nooo n noooo no nooooooo;--"Nooooooo no nooo noo no noo!"




Both were silent again, as one man. The grey dawn came on, and the
Nooo nooo nooooo noooo, no noo noo. Noo nooo nooo nooo no, noo noo

nooooooooo nooo noooo nooo noo nooo'n nooooo, noo noo nooo noo nooo

noooo noo noooooo no noo nooo.










CHAPTER 118. The Quadrant.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Nooooooo.







The season for the Line at length drew near; and every day when Ahab,
Noo nooooo noo noo Nooo no nooooo nooo nooo; noo noooo noo nooo Nooo,

coming from his cabin, cast his eyes aloft, the vigilant helmsman would
nooooo nooo noo noooo, nooo noo nooo noooo, noo nooooooo nooooooo noooo

ostentatiously handle his spokes, and the eager mariners quickly run to
nooooooooooooo nooooo noo nooooo, noo noo noooo nooooooo noooooo noo no

the braces, and would stand there with all their eyes centrally fixed
noo nooooo, noo noooo noooo noooo nooo noo noooo nooo noooooooo noooo

on the nailed doubloon; impatient for the order to point the ship's
no noo nooooo nooooooo; noooooooo noo noo noooo no noooo noo nooo'n

prow for the equator. In good time the order came. It was hard upon high
nooo noo noo noooooo. No nooo nooo noo noooo nooo. No noo nooo nooo nooo

noon; and Ahab, seated in the bows of his high-hoisted boat, was
nooo; noo Nooo, nooooo no noo nooo no noo nooo-noooooo nooo, noo

about taking his wonted daily observation of the sun to determine his
noooo nooooo noo nooooo noooo noooooooooo no noo noo no noooooooo noo

latitude.
nooooooo.




Now, in that Japanese sea, the days in summer are as freshets of
Noo, no nooo Nooooooo noo, noo nooo no nooooo noo no nooooooo no

effulgences. That unblinkingly vivid Japanese sun seems the blazing
noooooooooo. Nooo nooooooooooo noooo Nooooooo noo noooo noo noooooo

focus of the glassy ocean's immeasurable burning-glass. The sky looks
noooo no noo nooooo noooo'n nooooooooooo noooooo-noooo. Noo noo noooo

lacquered; clouds there are none; the horizon floats; and this nakedness
noooooooo; nooooo noooo noo nooo; noo noooooo nooooo; noo nooo noooooooo

of unrelieved radiance is as the insufferable splendors of God's throne.
no nooooooooo nooooooo no no noo nooooooooooo noooooooo no Noo'n nooooo.

Well that Ahab's quadrant was furnished with coloured glasses, through
Nooo nooo Nooo'n nooooooo noo noooooooo nooo nooooooo noooooo, noooooo

which to take sight of that solar fire. So, swinging his seated form
noooo no nooo noooo no nooo noooo nooo. No, nooooooo noo nooooo nooo

to the roll of the ship, and with his astrological-looking instrument
no noo nooo no noo nooo, noo nooo noo nooooooooooo-noooooo nooooooooo

placed to his eye, he remained in that posture for some moments to
nooooo no noo noo, no nooooooo no nooo noooooo noo nooo noooooo no

catch the precise instant when the sun should gain its precise meridian.
noooo noo noooooo noooooo nooo noo noo nooooo nooo noo noooooo nooooooo.

Meantime while his whole attention was absorbed, the Parsee was kneeling
Nooooooo noooo noo noooo noooooooo noo nooooooo, noo Nooooo noo nooooooo

beneath him on the ship's deck, and with face thrown up like Ahab's,
noooooo noo no noo nooo'n nooo, noo nooo nooo nooooo no nooo Nooo'n,

was eyeing the same sun with him; only the lids of his eyes half hooded
noo nooooo noo nooo noo nooo noo; nooo noo nooo no noo nooo nooo nooooo

their orbs, and his wild face was subdued to an earthly passionlessness.
noooo nooo, noo noo nooo nooo noo noooooo no no noooooo noooooooooooooo.

At length the desired observation was taken; and with his pencil upon
No nooooo noo noooooo noooooooooo noo noooo; noo nooo noo nooooo nooo

his ivory leg, Ahab soon calculated what his latitude must be at that
noo noooo noo, Nooo nooo nooooooooo nooo noo nooooooo nooo no no nooo

precise instant. Then falling into a moment's revery, he again looked up
noooooo noooooo. Nooo noooooo nooo n nooooo'n nooooo, no noooo nooooo no

towards the sun and murmured to himself: "Thou sea-mark! thou high and
noooooo noo noo noo nooooooo no noooooo: "Nooo noo-nooo! nooo nooo noo

mighty Pilot! thou tellest me truly where I AM--but canst thou cast the
nooooo Noooo! nooo noooooo no noooo noooo N NO--noo noooo nooo nooo noo

least hint where I SHALL be? Or canst thou tell where some other thing
noooo nooo noooo N NOOOO no? No noooo nooo nooo noooo nooo noooo noooo

besides me is this moment living? Where is Moby Dick? This instant thou
noooooo no no nooo nooooo nooooo? Noooo no Nooo Nooo? Nooo noooooo nooo

must be eyeing him. These eyes of mine look into the very eye that is
nooo no nooooo noo. Noooo nooo no nooo nooo nooo noo nooo noo nooo no

even now beholding him; aye, and into the eye that is even now equally
nooo noo noooooooo noo; noo, noo nooo noo noo nooo no nooo noo noooooo

beholding the objects on the unknown, thither side of thee, thou sun!"
noooooooo noo noooooo no noo noooooo, noooooo nooo no nooo, nooo noo!"




Then gazing at his quadrant, and handling, one after the other, its
Nooo nooooo no noo nooooooo, noo nooooooo, noo noooo noo noooo, noo

numerous cabalistical contrivances, he pondered again, and muttered:
nooooooo nooooooooooo nooooooooooo, no nooooooo noooo, noo nooooooo:

"Foolish toy! babies' plaything of haughty Admirals, and Commodores, and
"Noooooo noo! nooooo' noooooooo no noooooo Nooooooo, noo Nooooooooo, noo

Captains; the world brags of thee, of thy cunning and might; but what
Nooooooo; noo noooo noooo no nooo, no noo noooooo noo noooo; noo nooo

after all canst thou do, but tell the poor, pitiful point, where thou
noooo noo noooo nooo no, noo nooo noo nooo, noooooo noooo, noooo nooo

thyself happenest to be on this wide planet, and the hand that holds
noooooo noooooooo no no no nooo nooo nooooo, noo noo nooo nooo noooo

thee: no! not one jot more! Thou canst not tell where one drop of water
nooo: no! noo noo noo nooo! Nooo noooo noo nooo noooo noo nooo no noooo

or one grain of sand will be to-morrow noon; and yet with thy impotence
no noo noooo no nooo nooo no no-nooooo nooo; noo noo nooo noo noooooooo

thou insultest the sun! Science! Curse thee, thou vain toy; and cursed
nooo noooooooo noo noo! Noooooo! Noooo nooo, nooo nooo noo; noo nooooo

be all the things that cast man's eyes aloft to that heaven, whose live
no noo noo nooooo nooo nooo noo'n nooo noooo no nooo nooooo, noooo nooo

vividness but scorches him, as these old eyes are even now scorched
noooooooo noo nooooooo noo, no noooo noo nooo noo nooo noo nooooooo

nooo noo noooo, N noo! Noooo no nooooo no nooo noooo'n noooooo noo noo

glances of man's eyes; not shot from the crown of his head, as if God
noooooo no noo'n nooo; noo nooo nooo noo noooo no noo nooo, no no Noo

had meant him to gaze on his firmament. Curse thee, thou quadrant!"
noo noooo noo no nooo no noo noooooooo. Noooo nooo, nooo nooooooo!"

dashing it to the deck, "no longer will I guide my earthly way by thee;
noooooo no no noo nooo, "no nooooo nooo N noooo no noooooo noo no nooo;

the level ship's compass, and the level deadreckoning, by log and by
noo noooo nooo'n noooooo, noo noo noooo noooooooooooo, no noo noo no

line; THESE shall conduct me, and show me my place on the sea. Aye,"
nooo; NOOOO noooo noooooo no, noo nooo no no noooo no noo noo. Noo,"

lighting from the boat to the deck, "thus I trample on thee, thou paltry
nooooooo nooo noo nooo no noo nooo, "nooo N noooooo no nooo, nooo nooooo

thing that feebly pointest on high; thus I split and destroy thee!"
noooo nooo nooooo nooooooo no nooo; nooo N noooo noo noooooo nooo!"




As the frantic old man thus spoke and thus trampled with his live
No noo noooooo noo noo nooo noooo noo nooo nooooooo nooo noo nooo

and dead feet, a sneering triumph that seemed meant for Ahab, and a
noo nooo nooo, n nooooooo noooooo nooo nooooo noooo noo Nooo, noo n

nooooooooo noooooo nooo nooooo noooo noo noooooo--noooo nooooo nooo

noo nooo, nooooooooo Nooooo'n nooo. Nooooooooo no nooo noo nooooo nooo;

while, awestruck by the aspect of their commander, the seamen clustered
noooo, noooooooo no noo nooooo no noooo noooooooo, noo nooooo noooooooo

together on the forecastle, till Ahab, troubledly pacing the deck,
nooooooo no noo nooooooooo, nooo Nooo, nooooooooo nooooo noo nooo,

shouted out--"To the braces! Up helm!--square in!"
noooooo noo--"No noo nooooo! No nooo!--nooooo no!"




In an instant the yards swung round; and as the ship half-wheeled upon
No no noooooo noo noooo noooo noooo; noo no noo nooo nooo-noooooo nooo

noo nooo, noo noooo nooo-nooooo nooooooo noooo noooooo nooooo nooo

noo nooo, nooooo nooo, nooooo no noo noooo Noooooo noooooooooo no noo
