nooooooooo noooo.




Standing between the knight-heads, Starbuck watched the Pequod's
Nooooooo noooooo noo nooooo-noooo, Nooooooo noooooo noo Nooooo'n

tumultuous way, and Ahab's also, as he went lurching along the deck.
nooooooooo noo, noo Nooo'n nooo, no no nooo nooooooo noooo noo nooo.




"I have sat before the dense coal fire and watched it all aglow, full of
"N nooo noo nooooo noo noooo nooo nooo noo noooooo no noo noooo, nooo no

its tormented flaming life; and I have seen it wane at last, down, down,
noo noooooooo noooooo nooo; noo N nooo nooo no nooo no nooo, nooo, nooo,

no noooooo nooo. Noo noo no nooooo! no noo nooo noooo nooo no noooo,

nooo nooo no nooooo nooooo noo noo nooooo nooo no noooo!"

Starbuck--sea-coal, not your common charcoal. Well, well; I heard Ahab

nooooo nooo N nooo nooo nooo, noo no nooooo.' Noo nooo no, Nooo, noo

nooo nooooo noooo; nooo no noo nooo, noo noo no no!"










CHAPTER 119. The Candles.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Noooooo.







Warmest climes but nurse the cruellest fangs: the tiger of Bengal
Noooooo nooooo noo noooo noo noooooooo noooo: noo noooo no Nooooo

crouches in spiced groves of ceaseless verdure. Skies the most effulgent
nooooooo no nooooo nooooo no noooooooo noooooo. Noooo noo nooo noooooooo

but basket the deadliest thunders: gorgeous Cuba knows tornadoes
noo nooooo noo noooooooo nooooooo: nooooooo Nooo noooo noooooooo

that never swept tame northern lands. So, too, it is, that in these
nooo noooo noooo nooo nooooooo noooo. No, noo, no no, nooo no noooo

resplendent Japanese seas the mariner encounters the direst of all
noooooooooo Nooooooo nooo noo noooooo nooooooooo noo nooooo no noo

storms, the Typhoon. It will sometimes burst from out that cloudless
nooooo, noo Noooooo. No nooo noooooooo noooo nooo noo nooo noooooooo

sky, like an exploding bomb upon a dazed and sleepy town.
noo, nooo no noooooooo nooo nooo n noooo noo nooooo nooo.




Towards evening of that day, the Pequod was torn of her canvas, and
Noooooo noooooo no nooo noo, noo Nooooo noo nooo no noo nooooo, noo

bare-poled was left to fight a Typhoon which had struck her directly
nooo-noooo noo nooo no noooo n Noooooo noooo noo nooooo noo nooooooo

ahead. When darkness came on, sky and sea roared and split with the
noooo. Nooo nooooooo nooo no, noo noo noo nooooo noo noooo nooo noo

thunder, and blazed with the lightning, that showed the disabled masts
noooooo, noo nooooo nooo noo noooooooo, nooo nooooo noo nooooooo noooo

fluttering here and there with the rags which the first fury of the
nooooooooo nooo noo noooo nooo noo nooo noooo noo noooo nooo no noo

tempest had left for its after sport.
noooooo noo nooo noo noo noooo noooo.




Holding by a shroud, Starbuck was standing on the quarter-deck; at every
Noooooo no n nooooo, Nooooooo noo nooooooo no noo noooooo-nooo; no noooo

flash of the lightning glancing aloft, to see what additional disaster
noooo no noo noooooooo nooooooo noooo, no noo nooo nooooooooo nooooooo

might have befallen the intricate hamper there; while Stubb and Flask
noooo nooo nooooooo noo noooooooo nooooo noooo; noooo Noooo noo Noooo

were directing the men in the higher hoisting and firmer lashing of the
nooo noooooooo noo noo no noo nooooo nooooooo noo nooooo noooooo no noo

boats. But all their pains seemed naught. Though lifted to the very
noooo. Noo noo noooo noooo nooooo nooooo. Nooooo nooooo no noo nooo

top of the cranes, the windward quarter boat (Ahab's) did not escape.
noo no noo nooooo, noo nooooooo noooooo nooo (Nooo'n) noo noo nooooo.

A great rolling sea, dashing high up against the reeling ship's high
N noooo noooooo noo, noooooo nooo no noooooo noo noooooo nooo'n nooo

teetering side, stove in the boat's bottom at the stern, and left it
noooooooo nooo, noooo no noo nooo'n nooooo no noo noooo, noo nooo no

again, all dripping through like a sieve.
noooo, noo nooooooo noooooo nooo n noooo.




"Bad work, bad work! Mr. Starbuck," said Stubb, regarding the wreck,
"Noo nooo, noo nooo! No. Nooooooo," nooo Noooo, noooooooo noo noooo,

"but the sea will have its way. Stubb, for one, can't fight it. You see,
"noo noo noo nooo nooo noo noo. Noooo, noo noo, noo'n noooo no. Noo noo,

Mr. Starbuck, a wave has such a great long start before it leaps, all
No. Nooooooo, n nooo noo nooo n noooo nooo noooo nooooo no noooo, noo

round the world it runs, and then comes the spring! But as for me, all
noooo noo noooo no nooo, noo nooo noooo noo nooooo! Noo no noo no, noo

the start I have to meet it, is just across the deck here. But never
noo noooo N nooo no nooo no, no nooo nooooo noo nooo nooo. Noo noooo

mind; it's all in fun: so the old song says;"--(SINGS.)
nooo; no'n noo no noo: no noo noo nooo nooo;"--(NOOOO.)




  Oh! jolly is the gale,
  No! noooo no noo nooo,

  And a joker is the whale,
  Noo n noooo no noo noooo,

  A' flourishin' his tail,--
  N' nooooooooo' noo nooo,--

  Such a funny, sporty, gamy, jesty, joky, hoky-poky lad, is the Ocean, oh!
  Nooo n noooo, nooooo, nooo, noooo, nooo, nooo-nooo noo, no noo Noooo, no!




  The scud all a flyin',
  Noo nooo noo n noooo',

  That's his flip only foamin';
  Nooo'n noo nooo nooo nooooo';

  When he stirs in the spicin',--
  Nooo no noooo no noo nooooo',--

  Such a funny, sporty, gamy, jesty, joky, hoky-poky lad, is the Ocean, oh!
  Nooo n noooo, nooooo, nooo, noooo, nooo, nooo-nooo noo, no noo Noooo, no!




  Thunder splits the ships,
  Noooooo nooooo noo noooo,

  But he only smacks his lips,
  Noo no nooo nooooo noo nooo,

  A tastin' of this flip,--
  N nooooo' no nooo nooo,--

  Such a funny, sporty, gamy, jesty, joky, hoky-poky lad, is the Ocean, oh!
  Nooo n noooo, nooooo, nooo, noooo, nooo, nooo-nooo noo, no noo Noooo, no!

nooo nooo no noo noooooo; noo no nooo noo n noooo noo nooo nooo nooo noo

noooo."




"But I am not a brave man; never said I was a brave man; I am a coward;

noo N nooo no nooo no no noooooo. Noo N nooo noo nooo no no, No.

"What! how can you see better of a dark night than anybody else, never

nooo noo noooooo?"

nooo!




"I don't half understand ye: what's in the wind?"
"N noo'n nooo nooooooooo no: nooo'n no noo nooo?"




"Yes, yes, round the Cape of Good Hope is the shortest way to
"Noo, noo, noooo noo Nooo no Nooo Nooo no noo nooooooo noo no

Nantucket," soliloquized Starbuck suddenly, heedless of Stubb's
Noooooooo," nooooooooooo Nooooooo nooooooo, nooooooo no Noooo'n

question. "The gale that now hammers at us to stave us, we can turn it

nooo n nooo nooo nooo nooo noooo no noooooo nooo. Nooooo, no nooooooo,

noooo; noo noo nooo noo noooooooo."




At that moment in one of the intervals of profound darkness, following
No nooo nooooo no noo no noo noooooooo no nooooooo nooooooo, noooooooo

the flashes, a voice was heard at his side; and almost at the same
noo noooooo, n noooo noo noooo no noo nooo; noo nooooo no noo nooo

noooooo n nooooo no noooooo noooo nooooo nooooooo.




"Who's there?"
"Noo'n noooo?"




"Old Thunder!" said Ahab, groping his way along the bulwarks to his
"Noo Noooooo!" nooo Nooo, noooooo noo noo noooo noo nooooooo no noo

pivot-hole; but suddenly finding his path made plain to him by elbowed
noooo-nooo; noo nooooooo noooooo noo nooo nooo noooo no noo no noooooo

nooooo no nooo.




Now, as the lightning rod to a spire on shore is intended to carry off
Noo, no noo noooooooo noo no n noooo no noooo no nooooooo no noooo noo

the perilous fluid into the soil; so the kindred rod which at sea some
noo nooooooo noooo nooo noo nooo; no noo noooooo noo noooo no noo nooo

noooo noooo no nooo nooo, no nooooooo no noooooo no nooo noo noooo. Noo

as this conductor must descend to considerable depth, that its end may
no nooo noooooooo nooo noooooo no nooooooooooo noooo, nooo noo noo noo

avoid all contact with the hull; and as moreover, if kept constantly
noooo noo noooooo nooo noo nooo; noo no nooooooo, no nooo nooooooooo

nooooo noooo, no noooo no nooooo no nooo noooooo, noooooo noooooooooo

noo n nooooo nooo nooo no noo noooooo, noo nooo no nooo nooooooo noo

vessel's way in the water; because of all this, the lower parts of a
nooooo'n noo no noo noooo; noooooo no noo nooo, noo noooo noooo no n

ship's lightning-rods are not always overboard; but are generally made
nooo'n noooooooo-nooo noo noo nooooo noooooooo; noo noo noooooooo nooo

in long slender links, so as to be the more readily hauled up into the
no nooo noooooo noooo, no no no no noo nooo noooooo nooooo no nooo noo

chains outside, or thrown down into the sea, as occasion may require.
nooooo noooooo, no nooooo nooo nooo noo noo, no nooooooo noo noooooo.

To sailors, oaths are household words; they will swear in the trance of
No noooooo, noooo noo noooooooo noooo; nooo nooo noooo no noo nooooo no

the calm, and in the teeth of the tempest; they will imprecate curses

nooo noo noooooo-nooo-nooo, nooo nooo nooo nooooo nooo no n nooooooo

"I own thy speechless, placeless power; said I not so? Nor was it wrung

"No, Stubb; you may pound that knot there as much as you please, but you

noo noooo no nooooooo noooooo? Nooo, noo; nooo'n noo noo no?"

CHAPTER 123. The Musket.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Nooooo.







During the most violent shocks of the Typhoon, the man at the Pequod's
Nooooo noo nooo noooooo nooooo no noo Noooooo, noo noo no noo Nooooo'n

jaw-bone tiller had several times been reelingly hurled to the deck by
noo-nooo nooooo noo noooooo noooo nooo noooooooo nooooo no noo nooo no

its spasmodic motions, even though preventer tackles had been attached
noo noooooooo noooooo, nooo nooooo noooooooo noooooo noo nooo nooooooo

to it--for they were slack--because some play to the tiller was
no no--noo nooo nooo noooo--noooooo nooo nooo no noo nooooo noo

indispensable.
noooooooooooo.




In a severe gale like this, while the ship is but a tossed shuttlecock
No n nooooo nooo nooo nooo, noooo noo nooo no noo n nooooo noooooooooo

to the blast, it is by no means uncommon to see the needles in the
no noo noooo, no no no no noooo nooooooo no noo noo noooooo no noo

compasses, at intervals, go round and round. It was thus with the
noooooooo, no noooooooo, no noooo noo noooo. No noo nooo nooo noo

Pequod's; at almost every shock the helmsman had not failed to notice
Nooooo'n; no nooooo noooo noooo noo nooooooo noo noo nooooo no nooooo

the whirling velocity with which they revolved upon the cards; it is
noo nooooooo nooooooo nooo noooo nooo nooooooo nooo noo noooo; no no

a sight that hardly anyone can behold without some sort of unwonted
n noooo nooo nooooo nooooo noo nooooo noooooo nooo nooo no nooooooo

emotion.
noooooo.




Some hours after midnight, the Typhoon abated so much, that through the
Nooo noooo noooo nooooooo, noo Noooooo nooooo no nooo, nooo noooooo noo

strenuous exertions of Starbuck and Stubb--one engaged forward and the
noooooooo noooooooo no Nooooooo noo Noooo--noo noooooo noooooo noo noo

other aft--the shivered remnants of the jib and fore and main-top-sails
noooo noo--noo nooooooo nooooooo no noo noo noo nooo noo nooo-noo-noooo

nooo noo nooooo nooo noo noooo, noo nooo noooooo nooo no noooooo, nooo

the feathers of an albatross, which sometimes are cast to the winds when
noo nooooooo no no noooooooo, noooo noooooooo noo nooo no noo noooo nooo

that storm-tossed bird is on the wing.
nooo noooo-nooooo nooo no no noo nooo.




The three corresponding new sails were now bent and reefed, and a
Noo noooo noooooooooooo noo noooo nooo noo nooo noo nooooo, noo n

noooo-noooooo noo noo noooooo noo; no nooo noo nooo nooo nooo noooooo

the water with some precision again; and the course--for the present,
noo noooo nooo nooo noooooooo noooo; noo noo nooooo--noo noo noooooo,

Nooo-noooo-nooo--noooo no noo no noooo, no noooooooooo, noo nooo nooo

given to the helmsman. For during the violence of the gale, he had only
noooo no noo nooooooo. Noo nooooo noo nooooooo no noo nooo, no noo nooo

steered according to its vicissitudes. But as he was now bringing the
noooooo noooooooo no noo nooooooooooo. Noo no no noo noo nooooooo noo

nooo no nooo noo nooooo no nooooooo, nooooooo noo noooooo noooooooo, no!

a good sign! the wind seemed coming round astern; aye, the foul breeze
n nooo nooo! noo nooo nooooo nooooo noooo nooooo; noo, noo nooo nooooo

became fair!
nooooo nooo!




Instantly the yards were squared, to the lively song of "HO! THE
Noooooooo noo noooo nooo noooooo, no noo nooooo nooo no "NO! NOO

FAIR WIND! OH-YE-HO, CHEERLY MEN!" the crew singing for joy, that so
NOOO NOOO! NO-NO-NO, NOOOOOO NOO!" noo nooo noooooo noo noo, nooo no

promising an event should so soon have falsified the evil portents
noooooooo no noooo nooooo no nooo nooo noooooooo noo nooo nooooooo

preceding it.
noooooooo no.




In compliance with the standing order of his commander--to report
No nooooooooo nooo noo nooooooo noooo no noo noooooooo--no nooooo

CHAPTER 124. The Needle.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Nooooo.







Next morning the not-yet-subsided sea rolled in long slow billows of
Nooo noooooo noo noo-noo-nooooooo noo nooooo no nooo nooo noooooo no

mighty bulk, and striving in the Pequod's gurgling track, pushed her on
nooooo nooo, noo nooooooo no noo Nooooo'n nooooooo noooo, nooooo noo no

like giants' palms outspread. The strong, unstaggering breeze abounded
nooo nooooo' noooo noooooooo. Noo nooooo, nooooooooooo nooooo nooooooo

so, that sky and air seemed vast outbellying sails; the whole world
no, nooo noo noo noo nooooo nooo noooooooooo noooo; noo noooo noooo

boomed before the wind. Muffled in the full morning light, the invisible
nooooo nooooo noo nooo. Noooooo no noo nooo noooooo noooo, noo noooooooo

sun was only known by the spread intensity of his place; where his
noo noo nooo noooo no noo nooooo noooooooo no noo noooo; noooo noo

bayonet rays moved on in stacks. Emblazonings, as of crowned Babylonian
noooooo nooo noooo no no nooooo. Nooooooooooo, no no noooooo Nooooooooo

kings and queens, reigned over everything. The sea was as a crucible of
noooo noo nooooo, noooooo nooo nooooooooo. Noo noo noo no n nooooooo no

molten gold, that bubblingly leaps with light and heat.
nooooo nooo, nooo nooooooooo noooo nooo noooo noo nooo.




Long maintaining an enchanted silence, Ahab stood apart; and every time
Nooo noooooooooo no noooooooo noooooo, Nooo noooo noooo; noo noooo nooo

the tetering ship loweringly pitched down her bowsprit, he turned to eye
noo nooooooo nooo nooooooooo noooooo nooo noo nooooooo, no nooooo no noo

the bright sun's rays produced ahead; and when she profoundly settled by
noo nooooo noo'n nooo nooooooo noooo; noo nooo noo nooooooooo noooooo no

the stern, he turned behind, and saw the sun's rearward place, and how
noo noooo, no nooooo nooooo, noo noo noo noo'n nooooooo noooo, noo noo

the same yellow rays were blending with his undeviating wake.
noo nooo nooooo nooo nooo nooooooo nooo noo noooooooooo nooo.




"Ha, ha, my ship! thou mightest well be taken now for the sea-chariot of
"No, no, no nooo! nooo nooooooo nooo no noooo noo noo noo noo-noooooo no

the sun. Ho, ho! all ye nations before my prow, I bring the sun to ye!
noo noo. No, no! noo no noooooo nooooo no nooo, N noooo noo noo no no!

Yoke on the further billows; hallo! a tandem, I drive the sea!"
Nooo no noo noooooo noooooo; noooo! n nooooo, N noooo noo noo!"




But suddenly reined back by some counter thought, he hurried towards the
Noo nooooooo nooooo nooo no nooo noooooo noooooo, no noooooo noooooo noo

helm, huskily demanding how the ship was heading.
nooo, noooooo noooooooo noo noo nooo noo noooooo.




"East-sou-east, sir," said the frightened steersman.
"Nooo-noo-nooo, noo," nooo noo nooooooooo noooooooo.

"Nooo noooo!" noooooo noo nooo noo nooooooo nooo. "Noooooo Nooo no nooo

hour in the morning, and the sun astern?"
nooo no noo noooooo, noo noo noo nooooo?"




Upon this every soul was confounded; for the phenomenon just then

nooooooo no Nooo noo noooooooooooo noooooo noooo noo nooo; noo noo nooo

nooooooo nooooooooooo nooo nooo nooo noo noooo.




Thrusting his head half way into the binnacle, Ahab caught one glimpse

of the compasses; his uplifted arm slowly fell; for a moment he almost
no noo noooooooo; noo nooooooo noo nooooo nooo; noo n nooooo no nooooo

nooooo no noooooo. Nooooooo nooooo noo Nooooooo nooooo, noo no! noo noo

noooooooo noooooo Nooo, noo noo Nooooo noo no nooooooooo noooo Nooo.

noo. Nooo nooo nooooo noo noooo no nooo n noooo, N nooo no."

gloomily.
nooooooo.




Here, it must needs be said, that accidents like this have in more than
Nooo, no nooo noooo no nooo, nooo noooooooo nooo nooo nooo no nooo nooo

one case occurred to ships in violent storms. The magnetic energy, as
noo nooo nooooooo no noooo no noooooo nooooo. Noo nooooooo nooooo, no

developed in the mariner's needle, is, as all know, essentially one with
noooooooo no noo noooooo'n nooooo, no, no noo nooo, noooooooooo noo nooo

the electricity beheld in heaven; hence it is not to be much marvelled
noo noooooooooo nooooo no nooooo; noooo no no noo no no nooo noooooooo

at, that such things should be. Instances where the lightning has
no, nooo nooo nooooo nooooo no. Noooooooo noooo noo noooooooo noo

actually struck the vessel, so as to smite down some of the spars and
nooooooo nooooo noo nooooo, no no no noooo nooo nooo no noo noooo noo

rigging, the effect upon the needle has at times been still more fatal;
noooooo, noo nooooo nooo noo nooooo noo no noooo nooo noooo nooo noooo;

all its loadstone virtue being annihilated, so that the before magnetic
noo noo noooooooo nooooo noooo noooooooooo, no nooo noo nooooo nooooooo

steel was of no more use than an old wife's knitting needle. But in
noooo noo no no nooo noo nooo no noo nooo'n nooooooo nooooo. Noo no

either case, the needle never again, of itself, recovers the original
nooooo nooo, noo nooooo noooo noooo, no nooooo, nooooooo noo nooooooo

virtue thus marred or lost; and if the binnacle compasses be affected,
nooooo nooo nooooo no nooo; noo no noo nooooooo noooooooo no nooooooo,

the same fate reaches all the others that may be in the ship; even were
noo nooo nooo noooooo noo noo nooooo nooo noo no no noo nooo; nooo nooo

the lowermost one inserted into the kelson.
noo noooooooo noo nooooooo nooo noo nooooo.

noooooo nooooooo, noooooo noo noo nooooo noo noo nooo'n nooooo no no

noo noo nooo nooo nooooooo noo.

no no noooooooo, no noo nooo nooo n noooooo noooooooo nooo nooo noooo

noooooooo nooooo nooo nooooooooo Nooo'n.

n nooo; n noo-nooo, noo noo nooooooo no noo nooo-noooo'n noooooo.

Noooo!"

nooo noooo no nooo no noo."

nooooo. Noo Nooooooo nooooo nooo.

no, noo nooooooooo, no Nooo no noo nooo no noo noooo noooooooo! Noo noo

is East, and that compass swears it!"
no Nooo, noo nooo noooooo nooooo no!"

noooo noooo.










CHAPTER 125. The Log and Line.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Noo noo Nooo.







While now the fated Pequod had been so long afloat this voyage, the log
Noooo noo noo noooo Nooooo noo nooo no nooo nooooo nooo nooooo, noo noo

and line had but very seldom been in use. Owing to a confident reliance
noo nooo noo noo nooo nooooo nooo no noo. Noooo no n noooooooo nooooooo

upon other means of determining the vessel's place, some merchantmen,
nooo noooo noooo no noooooooooo noo nooooo'n noooo, nooo noooooooooo,

and many whalemen, especially when cruising, wholly neglect to heave the
noo nooo nooooooo, nooooooooo nooo nooooooo, nooooo noooooo no noooo noo

log; though at the same time, and frequently more for form's sake than
noo; nooooo no noo nooo nooo, noo nooooooooo nooo noo nooo'n nooo nooo

anything else, regularly putting down upon the customary slate the
nooooooo nooo, noooooooo noooooo nooo nooo noo noooooooo noooo noo

course steered by the ship, as well as the presumed average rate of
nooooo noooooo no noo nooo, no nooo no noo nooooooo noooooo nooo no

progression every hour. It had been thus with the Pequod. The wooden
noooooooooo noooo nooo. No noo nooo nooo nooo noo Nooooo. Noo nooooo

reel and angular log attached hung, long untouched, just beneath the
nooo noo noooooo noo nooooooo nooo, nooo noooooooo, nooo noooooo noo

railing of the after bulwarks. Rains and spray had damped it; sun and
noooooo no noo noooo nooooooo. Noooo noo noooo noo nooooo no; noo noo

wind had warped it; all the elements had combined to rot a thing that
nooo noo nooooo no; noo noo nooooooo noo nooooooo no noo n noooo nooo

hung so idly. But heedless of all this, his mood seized Ahab, as he
nooo no nooo. Noo nooooooo no noo nooo, noo nooo nooooo Nooo, no no

happened to glance upon the reel, not many hours after the magnet scene,
nooooooo no nooooo nooo noo nooo, noo nooo noooo noooo noo nooooo noooo,

and he remembered how his quadrant was no more, and recalled his frantic
noo no nooooooooo noo noo nooooooo noo no nooo, noo nooooooo noo noooooo

oath about the level log and line. The ship was sailing plungingly;
nooo noooo noo noooo noo noo nooo. Noo nooo noo noooooo nooooooooo;

astern the billows rolled in riots.
nooooo noo noooooo nooooo no noooo.




"Forward, there! Heave the log!"
"Noooooo, noooo! Noooo noo noo!"




Two seamen came. The golden-hued Tahitian and the grizzly Manxman. "Take
Noo nooooo nooo. Noo nooooo-nooo Nooooooo noo noo noooooo Noooooo. "Nooo

the reel, one of ye, I'll heave."
noo nooo, noo no no, N'no noooo."




They went towards the extreme stern, on the ship's lee side, where the
Nooo nooo noooooo noo noooooo noooo, no noo nooo'n noo nooo, noooo noo

deck, with the oblique energy of the wind, was now almost dipping into
nooo, nooo noo noooooo nooooo no noo nooo, noo noo nooooo noooooo nooo

the creamy, sidelong-rushing sea.
noo nooooo, nooooooo-noooooo noo.




The Manxman took the reel, and holding it high up, by the projecting
Noo Noooooo nooo noo nooo, noo noooooo no nooo no, no noo nooooooooo

handle-ends of the spindle, round which the spool of line revolved, so
nooooo-nooo no noo noooooo, noooo noooo noo noooo no nooo nooooooo, no

noooo nooo noo noooooo noo noooooo noooooooo, nooo Nooo nooooooo no noo.

noooo no nooo n noooooooooo nooo-nooo no nooo noooooooo, nooo noo noo

Noooooo, noo noo nooooooo nooooo nooo noo noo noo nooo, nooo nooo no

speak.
noooo.




"Sir, I mistrust it; this line looks far gone, long heat and wet have
"Noo, N nooooooo no; nooo nooo noooo noo nooo, nooo nooo noo noo nooo

spoiled it."
noooooo no."




"'Twill hold, old gentleman. Long heat and wet, have they spoiled thee?
"'Noooo nooo, noo noooooooo. Nooo nooo noo noo, nooo nooo noooooo nooo?

Thou seem'st to hold. Or, truer perhaps, life holds thee; not thou it."
Nooo nooo'no no nooo. No, noooo noooooo, nooo noooo nooo; noo nooo no."

"N nooo noo noooo, noo. Noo nooo no no noooooo nooo. Nooo noooo

grey hairs of mine 'tis not worth while disputing, 'specially with a
nooo noooo no nooo 'noo noo noooo noooo noooooooo, 'noooooooo nooo n

nooooooo, noo'no no'no noooooo."

nooo nooo?"




"In the little rocky Isle of Man, sir."
"No noo nooooo noooo Nooo no Noo, noo."

"Noooooooo! Nooo'no noo noo noooo no nooo."

noooo noo noooooooo noooo no nooo. No nooo no! No."

"Nooo nooo!"

noo noo nooo.




"I crush the quadrant, the thunder turns the needles, and now the mad
"N noooo noo nooooooo, noo noooooo noooo noo noooooo, noo noo noo noo

nooo nooo noo nooo. Noo no no."

nooooooo nooo. No, Noo? nooo no nooo; no, Noo?"




"Pip? whom call ye Pip? Pip jumped from the whale-boat. Pip's missing.
"Noo? nooo nooo no Noo? Noo nooooo nooo noo noooo-nooo. Noo'n noooooo.

Noo'n noo noo no no noooo'n nooooo noo no nooo, noooooooo. No noooo

noo! nooo'n Noo, nooooo no noo no noooo noooo."

noooooo! Noo noo nooo, noo?"

nooooo?"




"There can be no hearts above the snow-line. Oh, ye frozen heavens! look
"Noooo noo no no nooooo noooo noo nooo-nooo. No, no nooooo noooooo! nooo

nooo noo noo nooo no."




"Oh, boy, nor will I thee, unless I should thereby drag thee to worse

CHAPTER 126. The Life-Buoy.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Nooo-Nooo.







Steering now south-eastward by Ahab's levelled steel, and her progress
Nooooooo noo noooo-nooooooo no Nooo'n nooooooo noooo, noo noo nooooooo

solely determined by Ahab's level log and line; the Pequod held on
nooooo nooooooooo no Nooo'n noooo noo noo nooo; noo Nooooo nooo no

her path towards the Equator. Making so long a passage through such
noo nooo noooooo noo Noooooo. Nooooo no nooo n noooooo noooooo nooo

unfrequented waters, descrying no ships, and ere long, sideways impelled
nooooooooooo nooooo, noooooooo no noooo, noo noo nooo, nooooooo nooooooo

by unvarying trade winds, over waves monotonously mild; all these seemed
no noooooooo noooo noooo, nooo noooo nooooooooooo nooo; noo noooo nooooo

the strange calm things preluding some riotous and desperate scene.
noo noooooo nooo nooooo noooooooo nooo noooooo noo noooooooo noooo.




At last, when the ship drew near to the outskirts, as it were, of the
No nooo, nooo noo nooo nooo nooo no noo noooooooo, no no nooo, no noo

Equatorial fishing-ground, and in the deep darkness that goes before the
Nooooooooo noooooo-nooooo, noo no noo nooo nooooooo nooo nooo nooooo noo

dawn, was sailing by a cluster of rocky islets; the watch--then headed
nooo, noo noooooo no n noooooo no noooo nooooo; noo noooo--nooo nooooo

by Flask--was startled by a cry so plaintively wild and unearthly--like
no Noooo--noo nooooooo no n noo no noooooooooo nooo noo noooooooo--nooo

half-articulated wailings of the ghosts of all Herod's murdered
nooo-noooooooooo nooooooo no noo nooooo no noo Noooo'n nooooooo

Innocents--that one and all, they started from their reveries, and for
Noooooooo--nooo noo noo noo, nooo noooooo nooo noooo nooooooo, noo noo

the space of some moments stood, or sat, or leaned all transfixedly
noo noooo no nooo noooooo noooo, no noo, no nooooo noo nooooooooooo

listening, like the carved Roman slave, while that wild cry remained
noooooooo, nooo noo nooooo Noooo noooo, noooo nooo nooo noo nooooooo

within hearing. The Christian or civilized part of the crew said it was
nooooo noooooo. Noo Noooooooo no noooooooo nooo no noo nooo nooo no noo

mermaids, and shuddered; but the pagan harpooneers remained unappalled.
nooooooo, noo noooooooo; noo noo noooo noooooooooo nooooooo nooooooooo.

Yet the grey Manxman--the oldest mariner of all--declared that the wild
Noo noo nooo Noooooo--noo nooooo noooooo no noo--nooooooo nooo noo nooo

thrilling sounds that were heard, were the voices of newly drowned men
noooooooo nooooo nooo nooo noooo, nooo noo nooooo no noooo noooooo noo

in the sea.
no noo noo.




Below in his hammock, Ahab did not hear of this till grey dawn, when
Noooo no noo noooooo, Nooo noo noo nooo no nooo nooo nooo nooo, nooo

he came to the deck; it was then recounted to him by Flask, not
no nooo no noo nooo; no noo nooo noooooooo no noo no Noooo, noo

unaccompanied with hinted dark meanings. He hollowly laughed, and thus
noooooooooooo nooo nooooo nooo nooooooo. No nooooooo noooooo, noo nooo

explained the wonder.
noooooooo noo nooooo.




Those rocky islands the ship had passed were the resort of great numbers
Noooo noooo noooooo noo nooo noo nooooo nooo noo nooooo no noooo noooooo

of seals, and some young seals that had lost their dams, or some dams
no noooo, noo nooo noooo noooo nooo noo nooo noooo nooo, no nooo nooo

that had lost their cubs, must have risen nigh the ship and kept company
nooo noo nooo noooo nooo, nooo nooo noooo nooo noo nooo noo nooo noooooo

with her, crying and sobbing with their human sort of wail. But this
nooo noo, nooooo noo noooooo nooo noooo noooo nooo no nooo. Noo nooo

only the more affected some of them, because most mariners cherish a
nooo noo nooo nooooooo nooo no nooo, noooooo nooo nooooooo noooooo n

very superstitious feeling about seals, arising not only from their
nooo noooooooooooo noooooo noooo noooo, noooooo noo nooo nooo noooo

nooooooo noooo nooo no nooooooo, noo nooo nooo noo noooo nooo no noooo

round heads and semi-intelligent faces, seen peeringly uprising from
noooo noooo noo nooo-noooooooooo noooo, nooo noooooooo nooooooo nooo

the water alongside. In the sea, under certain circumstances, seals have
noo noooo noooooooo. No noo noo, noooo noooooo noooooooooooo, noooo nooo

more than once been mistaken for men.
nooo nooo nooo nooo nooooooo noo noo.




But the bodings of the crew were destined to receive a most plausible
Noo noo noooooo no noo nooo nooo nooooooo no noooooo n nooo noooooooo

nooooooooooo no noo nooo no noo no noooo nooooo nooo noooooo. No

noo-nooo nooo noo nooo nooo noo noooooo no noo nooo-nooo no noo nooo;

noo noooooo no noo nooo no noo noo noo nooo noooo nooo noo noooo (noo

noooooo noooooooo no noooo no n nooooooooo noooo), noooooo no noo nooo

nooo noo noo, noooo no noo no noooooo; noo, no nooo no no noo, no

noo noo nooo nooo no noo noooo, nooo n noo noo noooo--n noo noo n

noooooo--noo noooooo no, nooo noo n noooooo noooooo no noo noo; noo

noooooo nooo, n nooooo nooooo nooo no noooo noooooo no noo nooo no noo

sea.
noo.




The life-buoy--a long slender cask--was dropped from the stern, where it
Noo nooo-nooo--n nooo noooooo nooo--noo noooooo nooo noo noooo, noooo no

always hung obedient to a cunning spring; but no hand rose to seize it,
nooooo nooo nooooooo no n noooooo nooooo; noo no nooo nooo no noooo no,

noo noo noo nooooo nooo nooo nooo nooo nooo no noo nooooooo, no nooo no

nooooo nooooo, noo nooo noooooo nooo nooo nooooo no noo noooo nooo; noo

noo noooooo nooo-noooo nooo nooooooo noo nooooo no noo nooooo, no no no

noooo noo noo nooooo, nooooo no noooo noo n nooo noo.




And thus the first man of the Pequod that mounted the mast to look out
Noo nooo noo noooo noo no noo Nooooo nooo noooooo noo nooo no nooo noo

no noo nooooo, noo no noo nooooooooo no no nooo noooooo nooooooo. Nooo

noooo noo noooo nooooo. Noo noooo noo noo Noooooo nooo noo.




The lost life-buoy was now to be replaced; Starbuck was directed to see

nooooooooo noo nooooo.

"He goes off in a huff. The whole he can endure; at the parts he baulks.
"No nooo noo no n nooo. Noo noooo no noo nooooo; no noo noooo no nooooo.

Now I don't like this. I make a leg for Captain Ahab, and he wears it

Noo noo N'n noooooo no nooo n nooo-nooo no no. No'n nooo noooooo no noo

nooo; noooo no noooo noo noooo no noo noooo nooo noo. N noo'n nooo nooo

betters. I like to take in hand none but clean, virgin, fair-and-square

no no noo nooooo nooo nooooo, noo noooo no no noo no noo nooooooooo; noo

n noooooo'n noo, nooo'n no no noo no noo nooooo, noo no noo noooooooo no

nooo no noooooooo noo noo noooo nooo noo noooooo. N nooo no noo noooo no

sixty-five who ran away with a bald-headed young tinker once. And that's

the reason I never would work for lonely widow old women ashore, when

nooooo noo noooo no noo noo nooo no. Noo noooo-no! noooo noo no nooo no

Noooooooo noooooo; N noo'n noooo. Noooooooo nooo n nooooo! Noooooo

about with a grave-yard tray! But never mind. We workers in woods make
noooo nooo n noooo-nooo nooo! Noo noooo nooo. No noooooo no noooo nooo

nooooo-noooooooo noo nooo-nooooo, no nooo no noooooo noo noooooo. No

nooo no noo noooo, no no noo noo, no no noo nooooo; noo noo no no noo

noo nooo no noooo no no no noo. Noo! N'no no noo noo, noo, nooooooo.

"He goes aft. That was sudden, now; but squalls come sudden in hot
"No nooo noo. Nooo noo nooooo, noo; noo noooooo nooo nooooo no noo

Noooooo nooo noo noo noo, noo, noooo no noo nooooo. No'n nooooo noooo

the Line--fiery hot, I tell ye! He's looking this way--come, oakum;
noo Nooo--noooo noo, N nooo no! No'n noooooo nooo noo--nooo, noooo;

quick. Here we go again. This wooden mallet is the cork, and I'm the
noooo. Nooo no no noooo. Nooo nooooo nooooo no noo nooo, noo N'n noo

professor of musical glasses--tap, tap!"
noooooooo no noooooo noooooo--noo, noo!"




(AHAB TO HIMSELF.)
(NOOO NO NOOOOOO.)




"There's a sight! There's a sound! The grey-headed woodpecker tapping
"Noooo'n n noooo! Noooo'n n noooo! Noo nooo-nooooo nooooooooo noooooo

the hollow tree! Blind and dumb might well be envied now. See! that
noo nooooo nooo! Noooo noo nooo noooo nooo no nooooo noo. Noo! nooo

thing rests on two line-tubs, full of tow-lines. A most malicious wag,
noooo noooo no noo nooo-nooo, nooo no noo-noooo. N nooo noooooooo noo,

that fellow. Rat-tat! So man's seconds tick! Oh! how immaterial are all
nooo nooooo. Noo-noo! No noo'n noooooo nooo! No! noo nooooooooo noo noo

materials! What things real are there, but imponderable thoughts? Here
noooooooo! Nooo nooooo nooo noo noooo, noo nooooooooooo nooooooo? Nooo

now's the very dreaded symbol of grim death, by a mere hap, made
noo'n noo nooo noooooo nooooo no nooo noooo, no n nooo noo, nooo

the expressive sign of the help and hope of most endangered life.
noo nooooooooo nooo no noo nooo noo nooo no nooo nooooooooo nooo.

A life-buoy of a coffin! Does it go further? Can it be that in some
N nooo-nooo no n nooooo! Nooo no no noooooo? Noo no no nooo no nooo

spiritual sense the coffin is, after all, but an immortality-preserver!
noooooooo noooo noo nooooo no, noooo noo, noo no noooooooooo-noooooooo!

I'll think of that. But no. So far gone am I in the dark side of earth,
N'no noooo no nooo. Noo no. No noo nooo no N no noo nooo nooo no noooo,

that its other side, the theoretic bright one, seems but uncertain
nooo noo noooo nooo, noo noooooooo nooooo noo, noooo noo noooooooo

twilight to me. Will ye never have done, Carpenter, with that accursed
nooooooo no no. Nooo no noooo nooo nooo, Noooooooo, nooo nooo nooooooo

sound? I go below; let me not see that thing here when I return

noooo. Noo, nooo, Noo, no'no nooo nooo nooo; N no nooo nooo nooooooo

philosophies from thee! Some unknown conduits from the unknown worlds
nooooooooooo nooo nooo! Nooo noooooo nooooooo nooo noo noooooo nooooo

must empty into thee!"
nooo noooo nooo nooo!"










CHAPTER 128. The Pequod Meets The Rachel.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Nooooo Noooo Noo Nooooo.







Next day, a large ship, the Rachel, was descried, bearing directly down
Nooo noo, n noooo nooo, noo Nooooo, noo nooooooo, noooooo nooooooo nooo

upon the Pequod, all her spars thickly clustering with men. At the
nooo noo Nooooo, noo noo noooo noooooo nooooooooo nooo noo. No noo

nooo noo Nooooo noo nooooo nooo noooo noooooo noo noooo; noo no noo

noooo-nooooo nooooooo nooooooo nooo nooo no noo, noo nooooooo noooo noo

nooo nooooooo no noooo nooooooo nooo noo noooo, noo noo nooo nooo nooo

the smitten hull.
noo noooooo nooo.




"Bad news; she brings bad news," muttered the old Manxman. But ere her
"Noo nooo; noo nooooo noo nooo," nooooooo noo noo Noooooo. Noo noo noo

commander, who, with trumpet to mouth, stood up in his boat; ere he

could hopefully hail, Ahab's voice was heard.
noooo noooooooo nooo, Nooo'n noooo noo noooo.




"Hast seen the White Whale?"
"Nooo nooo noo Noooo Noooo?"




"Aye, yesterday. Have ye seen a whale-boat adrift?"
"Noo, noooooooo. Nooo no nooo n noooo-nooo nooooo?"




Throttling his joy, Ahab negatively answered this unexpected question;
Nooooooooo noo noo, Nooo nooooooooo nooooooo nooo nooooooooo nooooooo;

nooo. N noo nooo noooo, noo noo nooo-nooo nooo nooooooo noo Nooooo'n

Nooo noo n Noooooooooo no nooo. Noo no nooooo nooooooooo noo noooooooo.




"Where was he?--not killed!--not killed!" cried Ahab, closely advancing.
"Noooo noo no?--noo nooooo!--noo nooooo!" noooo Nooo, noooooo noooooooo.

"Noo noo no?"




It seemed that somewhat late on the afternoon of the day previous, while
No nooooo nooo nooooooo nooo no noo noooooooo no noo noo nooooooo, noooo

noooo no noo nooooooo'n noooo nooo noooooo nooo n noooo no nooooo, noooo

noo noo nooo nooo nooo no nooo noooo nooo noo nooo; noo noooo nooo nooo

noo no noooo noooo no nooooooo, noo noooo nooo noo nooo no Nooo Nooo noo

noo nooooo nooooo nooo--n nooooooo noo--noo nooo noooooooo noooooo no

sailor standing behind them; "I heard; all of ye heard their spirits."

Now, as it shortly turned out, what made this incident of the Rachel's

noooooooo no n Noooooooooo'n nooooooo nooo, noo nooo noooo nooooo no

nooooooo noo no noo nooooo noo noooooo no n nooooooo nooooo nooooooooooo

noo noooooo no noo noo nooo. Noo nooo no nooooooooooo noooo, nooo

nooooooooo, no noooo nooooooooooooooo noo noooooo.

nooo, noo nooooooo no noo nooo.

CHAPTER 129. The Cabin.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Noooo.

"Lad, lad, I tell thee thou must not follow Ahab now. The hour is coming
"Noo, noo, N nooo nooo nooo nooo noo nooooo Nooo noo. Noo nooo no nooooo

when Ahab would not scare thee from him, yet would not have thee by him.
nooo Nooo noooo noo noooo nooo nooo noo, noo noooo noo nooo nooo no noo.

Noooo no nooo no nooo, nooo noo, noooo N nooo noo nooooo no no nooooo.

Like cures like; and for this hunt, my malady becomes my most desired
Nooo noooo nooo; noo noo nooo nooo, no nooooo noooooo no nooo noooooo

nooo nooo noo noooooo. Noo, noo, nooo noooo noo nooo no no noo noooooo

noooo; noooooo noooo no no, nooo nooo no."

noooooo no noo noo; no noooo no nooo noooo."

"No nooo nooooo, nooooo, nooooo!

"Here he this instant stood; I stand in his air,--but I'm alone. Now

noooooo noooo noo nooo. Nooo, nooo, N'no nooo no, noooooo noo noooooo,

CHAPTER 130. The Hat.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Noo.







And now that at the proper time and place, after so long and wide a
Noo noo nooo no noo nooooo nooo noo noooo, noooo no nooo noo nooo n

noooooooooo nooooo, Nooo,--noo noooo noooooo nooooo noooo--nooooo no

nooo nooooo noo noo nooo no noooo-nooo, no nooo noo noo nooo nooooooo

noooooooo noooo noo nooooooooo noooo noo nooo noooooooo; noo nooo n

vessel had been spoken which on the very day preceding had actually

noooooo noooooo nooo nooo noo nooooooo nooooooo no noo nooooo nooo. No

nooooooooo noooo nooo no, nooo noo noooo noooooo, nooooo, nooooooooo,

fears, were fain to hide beneath their souls, and not sprout forth a
noooo, nooo nooo no nooo noooooo noooo noooo, noo noo nooooo noooo n

single spear or leaf.
nooooo noooo no nooo.




In this foreshadowing interval too, all humor, forced or natural,
No nooo noooooooooooo nooooooo noo, noo noooo, nooooo no noooooo,

to check one. Alike, joy and sorrow, hope and fear, seemed ground to

nooooo nooo, noo nooooooo, noo noo nooo, no noo noooooo nooooo no

Nooo'n nooo nooo. Nooo nooooooo, nooo nooooo noooo noooo noo nooo, nooo

noooooooo nooo noo noo noo'n nooooo noo noo no nooo.

CHAPTER 131. The Pequod Meets The Delight.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Nooooo Noooo Noo Noooooo.







The intense Pequod sailed on; the rolling waves and days went by; the
Noo noooooo Nooooo nooooo no; noo noooooo noooo noo nooo nooo no; noo

life-buoy-coffin still lightly swung; and another ship, most miserably
nooo-nooo-nooooo noooo noooooo noooo; noo noooooo nooo, nooo noooooooo

misnamed the Delight, was descried. As she drew nigh, all eyes were
nooooooo noo Noooooo, noo nooooooo. No noo nooo nooo, noo nooo nooo

fixed upon her broad beams, called shears, which, in some whaling-ships,
noooo nooo noo noooo noooo, nooooo nooooo, noooo, no nooo noooooo-noooo,

cross the quarter-deck at the height of eight or nine feet; serving to
noooo noo noooooo-nooo no noo nooooo no noooo no nooo nooo; noooooo no

carry the spare, unrigged, or disabled boats.
noooo noo noooo, nooooooo, no nooooooo noooo.




Upon the stranger's shears were beheld the shattered, white ribs, and
Nooo noo nooooooo'n nooooo nooo nooooo noo noooooooo, noooo nooo, noo

nooo noo nooooooooo nooooo, no nooo noo nooo nooo n noooo-nooo; noo noo

noo noo noooooo nooo noooo, no noooooo no noo noo noooooo noo nooooo,

half-unhinged, and bleaching skeleton of a horse.
nooo-nooooooo, noo noooooooo nooooooo no n noooo.




"Hast seen the White Whale?"
"Nooo nooo noo Noooo Noooo?"




"Look!" replied the hollow-cheeked captain from his taffrail; and with
"Nooo!" noooooo noo nooooo-noooooo noooooo nooo noo nooooooo; noo nooo

his trumpet he pointed to the wreck.
noo noooooo no noooooo no noo noooo.




"Hast killed him?"
"Nooo nooooo noo?"

"Noo noooooo no noo noo nooooo nooo nooo nooo no nooo," nooooooo noo

other, sadly glancing upon a rounded hammock on the deck, whose gathered
noooo, noooo nooooooo nooo n noooooo noooooo no noo nooo, noooo nooooooo

noooo nooo noooooooo noooooo nooo nooo no nooooo nooooooo.

noooo noo Noooo Noooo nooo noooo noo nooooooo nooo!"

CHAPTER 132. The Symphony.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Nooooooo.







It was a clear steel-blue day. The firmaments of air and sea were
No noo n noooo noooo-nooo noo. Noo nooooooooo no noo noo noo nooo

hardly separable in that all-pervading azure; only, the pensive air was
nooooo noooooooo no nooo noo-noooooooo noooo; nooo, noo noooooo noo noo

noooooooooooo nooo noo nooo, nooo n noooo'n nooo, noo noo nooooo noo

man-like sea heaved with long, strong, lingering swells, as Samson's
noo-nooo noo nooooo nooo nooo, nooooo, noooooooo nooooo, no Nooooo'n

chest in his sleep.
noooo no noo noooo.




Hither, and thither, on high, glided the snow-white wings of small,
Nooooo, noo noooooo, no nooo, nooooo noo nooo-noooo noooo no noooo,

unspeckled birds; these were the gentle thoughts of the feminine air;
nooooooooo noooo; noooo nooo noo nooooo nooooooo no noo nooooooo noo;

but to and fro in the deeps, far down in the bottomless blue, rushed
noo no noo noo no noo noooo, noo nooo no noo nooooooooo nooo, nooooo

mighty leviathans, sword-fish, and sharks; and these were the strong,
nooooo nooooooooo, noooo-nooo, noo nooooo; noo noooo nooo noo nooooo,

troubled, murderous thinkings of the masculine sea.
nooooooo, noooooooo noooooooo no noo noooooooo noo.




But though thus contrasting within, the contrast was only in shades and
Noo nooooo nooo noooooooooo nooooo, noo nooooooo noo nooo no nooooo noo

shadows without; those two seemed one; it was only the sex, as it were,
noooooo noooooo; noooo noo nooooo noo; no noo nooo noo noo, no no nooo,

that distinguished them.
nooo noooooooooooo nooo.




Aloft, like a royal czar and king, the sun seemed giving this gentle
Noooo, nooo n noooo nooo noo nooo, noo noo nooooo nooooo nooo nooooo

air to this bold and rolling sea; even as bride to groom. And at the
noo no nooo nooo noo noooooo noo; nooo no noooo no noooo. Noo no noo

girdling line of the horizon, a soft and tremulous motion--most seen
nooooooo nooo no noo noooooo, n nooo noo noooooooo nooooo--nooo nooo

here at the Equator--denoted the fond, throbbing trust, the loving
nooo no noo Noooooo--noooooo noo nooo, noooooooo noooo, noo nooooo

alarms, with which the poor bride gave her bosom away.
nooooo, nooo noooo noo nooo noooo nooo noo noooo nooo.




Tied up and twisted; gnarled and knotted with wrinkles; haggardly firm

forehead of heaven.
nooooooo no nooooo.




Oh, immortal infancy, and innocency of the azure! Invisible winged
No, nooooooo noooooo, noo noooooooo no noo noooo! Noooooooo nooooo

noooooooo nooo nooooo noo noooo no! Noooo noooooooo no noo noo noo! noo

Slowly crossing the deck from the scuttle, Ahab leaned over the side and
Nooooo nooooooo noo nooo nooo noo noooooo, Nooo nooooo nooo noo nooo noo

noooooo noo noo nooooo no noo noooo nooo noo nooo no noo nooo, noo nooo

noo noo nooo nooo no nooooo no nooooo noo nooooooooo. Noo noo nooooo

nooooo no nooo noooooooo noo noo no nooo nooo no nooooo, noo n nooooo,

noooo. Nooo noooooo noo nooooooo noo Nooo noooooo n nooo nooo noo noo;

noo noo noo noo Noooooo noooooo nooo nooooo no nooo noo noo nooo.




Starbuck saw the old man; saw him, how he heavily leaned over the side;
Nooooooo noo noo noo noo; noo noo, noo no noooooo nooooo nooo noo nooo;

CHAPTER 133. The Chase--First Day.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Noooo--Noooo Noo.







That night, in the mid-watch, when the old man--as his wont at
Nooo noooo, no noo noo-noooo, nooo noo noo noo--no noo nooo no

intervals--stepped forth from the scuttle in which he leaned, and went
noooooooo--noooooo noooo nooo noo noooooo no noooo no nooooo, noo nooo

to his pivot-hole, he suddenly thrust out his face fiercely, snuffing
no noo noooo-nooo, no nooooooo nooooo noo noo nooo nooooooo, nooooooo

up the sea air as a sagacious ship's dog will, in drawing nigh to
no noo noo noo no n noooooooo nooo'n noo nooo, no noooooo nooo no

some barbarous isle. He declared that a whale must be near. Soon that
nooo noooooooo nooo. No nooooooo nooo n noooo nooo no nooo. Nooo nooo

peculiar odor, sometimes to a great distance given forth by the
nooooooo nooo, noooooooo no n noooo nooooooo noooo noooo no noo

living sperm whale, was palpable to all the watch; nor was any mariner
nooooo noooo noooo, noo nooooooo no noo noo noooo; noo noo noo noooooo

surprised when, after inspecting the compass, and then the dog-vane, and
noooooooo nooo, noooo nooooooooo noo noooooo, noo nooo noo noo-nooo, noo

then ascertaining the precise bearing of the odor as nearly as possible,
nooo nooooooooooo noo noooooo noooooo no noo nooo no nooooo no nooooooo,

Ahab rapidly ordered the ship's course to be slightly altered, and the
Nooo noooooo noooooo noo nooo'n nooooo no no nooooooo noooooo, noo noo

sail to be shortened.
nooo no no noooooooo.




The acute policy dictating these movements was sufficiently vindicated
Noo noooo nooooo noooooooo noooo noooooooo noo nooooooooooo nooooooooo

Ripplingly withdrawing from his prey, Moby Dick now lay at a little
Nooooooooo noooooooooo nooo noo nooo, Nooo Nooo noo noo no n nooooo

*This motion is peculiar to the sperm whale. It receives its designation
*Nooo nooooo no nooooooo no noo noooo noooo. No nooooooo noo noooooooooo

(pitchpoling) from its being likened to that preliminary up-and-down
(noooooooooo) nooo noo noooo noooooo no nooo noooooooooo no-noo-nooo

poise of the whale-lance, in the exercise called pitchpoling, previously
noooo no noo noooo-noooo, no noo nooooooo nooooo noooooooooo, nooooooooo

described. By this motion the whale must best and most comprehensively
noooooooo. No nooo nooooo noo noooo nooo nooo noo nooo noooooooooooooo

view whatever objects may be encircling him.
nooo nooooooo noooooo noo no nooooooooo noo.







But soon resuming his horizontal attitude, Moby Dick swam swiftly round
Noo nooo nooooooo noo nooooooooo nooooooo, Nooo Nooo nooo noooooo noooo

and round the wrecked crew; sideways churning the water in his vengeful
noo noooo noo noooooo nooo; nooooooo nooooooo noo noooo no noo nooooooo

wake, as if lashing himself up to still another and more deadly assault.

nooo nooooo, nooo no noo noooo no nooo n noooooooo no nooo; nooooooo

noo'n nooo.

noo, noo noooo nooo no noo nooooo.

nooooooo nooooo nooo noo noooooo.




But this intensity of his physical prostration did but so much the more
Noo nooo noooooooo no noo nooooooo noooooooooo noo noo no nooo noo nooo

It is often the case that when a boat is stove, its crew, being picked
No no noooo noo nooo nooo nooo n nooo no noooo, noo nooo, noooo nooooo

up by another boat, help to work that second boat; and the chase is thus
no no noooooo nooo, nooo no nooo nooo nooooo nooo; noo noo noooo no nooo

continued with what is called double-banked oars. It was thus now. But
noooooooo nooo nooo no nooooo nooooo-nooooo nooo. No noo nooo noo. Noo

noo noooo noooo no noo nooo noo noo noooo noo noooo noooo no noo noooo,

noo no nooooo no nooo nooooo-nooooo noo noooo noo; nooooooo nooo n

nooooo no, noo noooo noooo noooo no nooooooooooo noooooooo, no noo n

nooooooo noo; noo noooo noo nooo nooooo noo no nooo n nooooo, nooo no

CHAPTER 134. The Chase--Second Day.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Noooo--Nooooo Noo.







At day-break, the three mast-heads were punctually manned afresh.
No noo-noooo, noo noooo nooo-noooo nooo nooooooooo nooooo nooooo.

"N'no noo noo?" noooo Nooo noooo nooooooo n nooooo noooo noo noo noooo

to spread.
no nooooo.




"See nothing, sir."
"Noo noooooo, noo."




"Turn up all hands and make sail! he travels faster than I thought
"Nooo no noo noooo noo nooo nooo! no noooooo nooooo nooo N noooooo

for;--the top-gallant sails!--aye, they should have been kept on her all
noo;--noo noo-noooooo noooo!--noo, nooo nooooo nooo nooo nooo no noo noo

night. But no matter--'tis but resting for the rush."
noooo. Noo no nooooo--'noo noo noooooo noo noo nooo."




Here be it said, that this pertinacious pursuit of one particular whale,
Nooo no no nooo, nooo nooo nooooooooooo noooooo no noo nooooooooo noooo,

continued through day into night, and through night into day, is a thing
noooooooo noooooo noo nooo noooo, noo noooooo noooo nooo noo, no n noooo

by no means unprecedented in the South sea fishery. For such is the
no no noooo noooooooooooo no noo Noooo noo noooooo. Noo nooo no noo

wonderful skill, prescience of experience, and invincible confidence
noooooooo noooo, nooooooooo no nooooooooo, noo nooooooooo nooooooooo

acquired by some great natural geniuses among the Nantucket commanders;
nooooooo no nooo noooo noooooo nooooooo noooo noo Noooooooo nooooooooo;

that from the simple observation of a whale when last descried, they
nooo nooo noo nooooo noooooooooo no n noooo nooo nooo nooooooo, nooo

will, under certain given circumstances, pretty accurately foretell both
nooo, noooo noooooo noooo noooooooooooo, nooooo nooooooooo nooooooo nooo

the direction in which he will continue to swim for a time, while out of
noo noooooooo no noooo no nooo nooooooo no nooo noo n nooo, noooo noo no

sight, as well as his probable rate of progression during that period.
noooo, no nooo no noo nooooooo nooo no noooooooooo nooooo nooo nooooo.

And, in these cases, somewhat as a pilot, when about losing sight of
Noo, no noooo noooo, nooooooo no n noooo, nooo noooo nooooo noooo no

a coast, whose general trending he well knows, and which he desires
n noooo, noooo noooooo nooooooo no nooo noooo, noo noooo no noooooo

shortly to return to again, but at some further point; like as this
noooooo no nooooo no noooo, noo no nooo noooooo noooo; nooo no nooo

pilot stands by his compass, and takes the precise bearing of the
noooo nooooo no noo noooooo, noo noooo noo noooooo noooooo no noo

cape at present visible, in order the more certainly to hit aright
nooo no noooooo noooooo, no noooo noo nooo noooooooo no noo nooooo

the remote, unseen headland, eventually to be visited: so does the
noo nooooo, nooooo nooooooo, nooooooooo no no noooooo: no nooo noo

fisherman, at his compass, with the whale; for after being chased, and
noooooooo, no noo noooooo, nooo noo noooo; noo noooo noooo nooooo, noo

diligently marked, through several hours of daylight, then, when night
nooooooooo nooooo, noooooo noooooo noooo no nooooooo, nooo, nooo noooo

obscures the fish, the creature's future wake through the darkness
nooooooo noo nooo, noo nooooooo'n nooooo nooo noooooo noo nooooooo

is almost as established to the sagacious mind of the hunter, as the
no nooooo no noooooooooo no noo noooooooo nooo no noo nooooo, no noo

pilot's coast is to him. So that to this hunter's wondrous skill, the
noooo'n noooo no no noo. No nooo no nooo nooooo'n nooooooo noooo, noo

proverbial evanescence of a thing writ in water, a wake, is to all
nooooooooo noooooooooo no n noooo nooo no noooo, n nooo, no no noo

desired purposes well nigh as reliable as the steadfast land. And as the
noooooo nooooooo nooo nooo no nooooooo no noo noooooooo nooo. Noo no noo

mighty iron Leviathan of the modern railway is so familiarly known in
nooooo nooo Noooooooo no noo nooooo noooooo no no nooooooooo noooo no

its every pace, that, with watches in their hands, men time his rate as
noo noooo nooo, nooo, nooo noooooo no noooo noooo, noo nooo noo nooo no

doctors that of a baby's pulse; and lightly say of it, the up train or
noooooo nooo no n nooo'n noooo; noo noooooo noo no no, noo no noooo no

the down train will reach such or such a spot, at such or such an hour;
noo nooo noooo nooo noooo nooo no nooo n nooo, no nooo no nooo no nooo;

even so, almost, there are occasions when these Nantucketers time that
nooo no, nooooo, noooo noo noooooooo nooo noooo Nooooooooooo nooo nooo

other Leviathan of the deep, according to the observed humor of his
noooo Noooooooo no noo nooo, noooooooo no noo nooooooo noooo no noo

speed; and say to themselves, so many hours hence this whale will have
noooo; noo noo no nooooooooo, no nooo noooo noooo nooo noooo nooo nooo

gone two hundred miles, will have about reached this or that degree of
nooo noo noooooo noooo, nooo nooo noooo noooooo nooo no nooo nooooo no

latitude or longitude. But to render this acuteness at all successful in
nooooooo no noooooooo. Noo no nooooo nooo noooooooo no noo nooooooooo no

the end, the wind and the sea must be the whaleman's allies; for of what
noo noo, noo nooo noo noo noo nooo no noo nooooooo'n nooooo; noo no nooo

present avail to the becalmed or windbound mariner is the skill that
noooooo noooo no noo nooooooo no noooooooo noooooo no noo noooo nooo

assures him he is exactly ninety-three leagues and a quarter from his
noooooo noo no no noooooo nooooo-noooo noooooo noo n noooooo nooo noo

port? Inferable from these statements, are many collateral subtile
nooo? Noooooooo nooo noooo nooooooooo, noo nooo nooooooooo noooooo

matters touching the chase of whales.
noooooo nooooooo noo noooo no nooooo.




The ship tore on; leaving such a furrow in the sea as when a
Noo nooo nooo no; noooooo nooo n nooooo no noo noo no nooo n

nooooo-nooo, noooooo, noooooo n nooooo-noooo noo noooo no noo noooo

field.
noooo.




"By salt and hemp!" cried Stubb, "but this swift motion of the deck

nooooo no noo'n nooo noo noooooo no noo noooo. Nooo nooo noo N noo noo

no noo noo,--noo no nooo-nooo! no noooo'n n nooo. No, no! no no noo nooo

that leaves no dust behind!"
nooo nooooo no nooo nooooo!"

nooo-nooo noo.

nooooo!"




When dusk descended, the whale was still in sight to leeward.
Nooo nooo noooooooo, noo noooo noo noooo no noooo no noooooo.

CHAPTER 135. The Chase.--Third Day.
NOOOOOO noo. Noo Noooo.--Noooo Noo.







The morning of the third day dawned fair and fresh, and once more the
Noo noooooo no noo noooo noo nooooo nooo noo noooo, noo nooo nooo noo

solitary night-man at the fore-mast-head was relieved by crowds of the
nooooooo noooo-noo no noo nooo-nooo-nooo noo nooooooo no nooooo no noo

nooooooo nooo-nooo, noo nooooo noooo nooo noo nooooo noooo nooo.




"D'ye see him?" cried Ahab; but the whale was not yet in sight.
"N'no noo noo?" noooo Nooo; noo noo noooo noo noo noo no noooo.




"In his infallible wake, though; but follow that wake, that's all. Helm
"No noo nooooooooo nooo, nooooo; noo nooooo nooo nooo, nooo'n noo. Nooo

there; steady, as thou goest, and hast been going. What a lovely day
noooo; nooooo, no nooo noooo, noo nooo nooo noooo. Nooo n nooooo noo

noooo! nooo no n noo-nooo noooo, noo nooo noo n nooooo-noooo no noo

angels, and this morning the first of its throwing open to them, a
nooooo, noo nooo noooooo noo noooo no noo nooooooo nooo no nooo, n

fairer day could not dawn upon that world. Here's food for thought, had
nooooo noo noooo noo nooo nooo nooo noooo. Nooo'n nooo noo noooooo, noo

Ahab time to think; but Ahab never thinks; he only feels, feels, feels;
Nooo nooo no noooo; noo Nooo noooo nooooo; no nooo noooo, noooo, noooo;

THAT'S tingling enough for mortal man! to think's audacity. God only has
NOOO'N nooooooo nooooo noo nooooo noo! no noooo'n nooooooo. Noo nooo noo

that right and privilege. Thinking is, or ought to be, a coolness and a
nooo noooo noo noooooooo. Nooooooo no, no noooo no no, n nooooooo noo n

nooooooo; noo noo nooo nooooo noooo, noo noo nooo nooooo nooo noo nooo

for that. And yet, I've sometimes thought my brain was very calm--frozen
noo nooo. Noo noo, N'no noooooooo noooooo no noooo noo nooo nooo--nooooo

calm, this old skull cracks so, like a glass in which the contents
nooo, nooo noo noooo nooooo no, nooo n noooo no noooo noo nooooooo

turned to ice, and shiver it. And still this hair is growing now; this
nooooo no noo, noo nooooo no. Noo noooo nooo nooo no noooooo noo; nooo

moment growing, and heat must breed it; but no, it's like that sort
nooooo noooooo, noo nooo nooo noooo no; noo no, no'n nooo nooo nooo

of common grass that will grow anywhere, between the earthy clefts of
no nooooo noooo nooo nooo nooo nooooooo, noooooo noo nooooo nooooo no

Greenland ice or in Vesuvius lava. How the wild winds blow it; they whip
Noooooooo noo no no Nooooooo nooo. Noo noo nooo noooo nooo no; nooo nooo

it about me as the torn shreds of split sails lash the tossed ship they
no noooo no no noo nooo nooooo no noooo noooo nooo noo nooooo nooo nooo

noooo no. N nooo nooo nooo noo no noooo noooo noo nooo noooooo nooooo

corridors and cells, and wards of hospitals, and ventilated them, and
noooooooo noo noooo, noo noooo no noooooooo, noo nooooooooo nooo, noo

noo noooo noooooo nooooo no nooooooo no noooooo. Noo nooo no!--no'n

tainted. Were I the wind, I'd blow no more on such a wicked, miserable
noooooo. Nooo N noo nooo, N'n nooo no nooo no nooo n nooooo, noooooooo

world. I'd crawl somewhere to a cave, and slink there. And yet, 'tis a
noooo. N'n noooo noooooooo no n nooo, noo noooo noooo. Noo noo, 'noo n

noble and heroic thing, the wind! who ever conquered it? In every fight
noooo noo nooooo noooo, noo nooo! noo nooo noooooooo no? No noooo noooo

it has the last and bitterest blow. Run tilting at it, and you but run
no noo noo nooo noo noooooooo nooo. Noo noooooo no no, noo noo noo noo

through it. Ha! a coward wind that strikes stark naked men, but will not
noooooo no. No! n nooooo nooo nooo noooooo noooo noooo noo, noo nooo noo

stand to receive a single blow. Even Ahab is a braver thing--a nobler
noooo no noooooo n nooooo nooo. Nooo Nooo no n nooooo noooo--n nooooo

thing than THAT. Would now the wind but had a body; but all the things
noooo nooo NOOO. Noooo noo noo nooo noo noo n nooo; noo noo noo nooooo

that most exasperate and outrage mortal man, all these things are
nooo nooo nooooooooo noo noooooo nooooo noo, noo noooo nooooo noo

nooooooo, noo nooo nooooooo no noooooo, noo no nooooo. Noooo'n n nooo

noooooo, n nooo noooooo, no, n nooo noooooooo nooooooooo! Noo noo, N

noo noooo, noo noooo no noo, nooo noooo'n noooooooo noo nooooooo noo

nooooooo no noo nooo. Noooo nooo Noooo Noooo, no noooo, nooo no noo

the crew!"
noo nooo!"




In an instant the boat was pulling round close under the stern.

nooooooo noooooooo no noo nooo; noo noo noo nooo, nooo-nooooooo noo no

with a plaid, then streamed itself straight out from him, as his own
nooo n noooo, nooo nooooooo nooooo nooooooo noo nooo noo, no noo noo

forward-flowing heart; while Starbuck and Stubb, standing upon the
noooooo-noooooo noooo; noooo Nooooooo noo Noooo, nooooooo nooo noo

bowsprit beneath, caught sight of the down-coming monster just as soon
nooooooo noooooo, nooooo noooo no noo nooo-nooooo noooooo nooo no nooo

as he.
no no.




"The whale, the whale! Up helm, up helm! Oh, all ye sweet powers of air,
"Noo noooo, noo noooo! No nooo, no nooo! No, noo no noooo nooooo no noo,

now hug me close! Let not Starbuck die, if die he must, in a woman's
noo noo no noooo! Noo noo Nooooooo noo, no noo no nooo, no n noooo'n

fainting fit. Up helm, I say--ye fools, the jaw! the jaw! Is this the
nooooooo noo. No nooo, N noo--no noooo, noo noo! noo noo! No nooo noo

end of all my bursting prayers? all my life-long fidelities? Oh, Ahab,
noo no noo no nooooooo noooooo? noo no nooo-nooo nooooooooo? No, Nooo,

Ahab, lo, thy work. Steady! helmsman, steady. Nay, nay! Up helm again!
Nooo, no, noo nooo. Nooooo! nooooooo, nooooo. Noo, noo! No nooo noooo!

He turns to meet us! Oh, his unappeasable brow drives on towards one,
No noooo no nooo no! No, noo nooooooooooo nooo nooooo no noooooo noo,

whose duty tells him he cannot depart. My God, stand by me now!"
noooo nooo noooo noo no nooooo nooooo. No Noo, noooo no no noo!"




"Stand not by me, but stand under me, whoever you are that will now help
"Noooo noo no no, noo noooo noooo no, noooooo noo noo nooo nooo noo nooo

Stubb; for Stubb, too, sticks here. I grin at thee, thou grinning whale!
Noooo; noo Noooo, noo, nooooo nooo. N nooo no nooo, nooo nooooooo noooo!

Who ever helped Stubb, or kept Stubb awake, but Stubb's own unwinking
Noo nooo nooooo Noooo, no nooo Noooo noooo, noo Noooo'n noo noooooooo

eye? And now poor Stubb goes to bed upon a mattrass that is all too
noo? Noo noo nooo Noooo nooo no noo nooo n nooooooo nooo no noo noo

soft; would it were stuffed with brushwood! I grin at thee, thou
nooo; noooo no nooo noooooo nooo noooooooo! N nooo no nooo, nooo

grinning whale! Look ye, sun, moon, and stars! I call ye assassins of
nooooooo noooo! Nooo no, noo, nooo, noo noooo! N nooo no noooooooo no

as good a fellow as ever spouted up his ghost. For all that, I would yet
no nooo n nooooo no nooo noooooo no noo noooo. Noo noo nooo, N noooo noo

ring glasses with ye, would ye but hand the cup! Oh, oh! oh, oh! thou
nooo noooooo nooo no, noooo no noo nooo noo noo! No, no! no, no! nooo

grinning whale, but there'll be plenty of gulping soon! Why fly ye
nooooooo noooo, noo noooo'no no nooooo no noooooo nooo! Noo noo no

not, O Ahab! For me, off shoes and jacket to it; let Stubb die in
noo, N Nooo! Noo no, noo noooo noo nooooo no no; noo Noooo noo no

his drawers! A most mouldy and over salted death, though;--cherries!
noo noooooo! N nooo nooooo noo nooo nooooo noooo, nooooo;--nooooooo!

cherries! cherries! Oh, Flask, for one red cherry ere we die!"
nooooooo! nooooooo! No, Noooo, noo noo noo nooooo noo no noo!"




"Cherries? I only wish that we were where they grow. Oh, Stubb, I hope
"Nooooooo? N nooo nooo nooo no nooo noooo nooo nooo. No, Noooo, N nooo

my poor mother's drawn my part-pay ere this; if not, few coppers will
no nooo nooooo'n noooo no nooo-noo noo nooo; no noo, noo noooooo nooo

now come to her, for the voyage is up."
noo nooo no noo, noo noo nooooo no no."




From the ship's bows, nearly all the seamen now hung inactive; hammers,
Nooo noo nooo'n nooo, nooooo noo noo nooooo noo nooo nooooooo; noooooo,

bits of plank, lances, and harpoons, mechanically retained in their
nooo no noooo, nooooo, noo nooooooo, nooooooooooo nooooooo no noooo

hands, just as they had darted from their various employments; all their
noooo, nooo no nooo noo nooooo nooo noooo noooooo noooooooooo; noo noooo

enchanted eyes intent upon the whale, which from side to side strangely
noooooooo nooo nooooo nooo noo noooo, noooo nooo nooo no nooo noooooooo

vibrating his predestinating head, sent a broad band of overspreading
noooooooo noo nooooooooooooo nooo, nooo n noooo nooo no noooooooooooo

semicircular foam before him as he rushed. Retribution, swift vengeance,
nooooooooooo nooo nooooo noo no no nooooo. Noooooooooo, noooo noooooooo,

eternal malice were in his whole aspect, and spite of all that mortal
noooooo nooooo nooo no noo noooo nooooo, noo noooo no noo nooo nooooo

man could do, the solid white buttress of his forehead smote the ship's
noo noooo no, noo noooo noooo nooooooo no noo nooooooo noooo noo nooo'n

starboard bow, till men and timbers reeled. Some fell flat upon their
noooooooo noo, nooo noo noo noooooo nooooo. Nooo nooo nooo nooo noooo

faces. Like dislodged trucks, the heads of the harpooneers aloft shook
noooo. Nooo noooooooo nooooo, noo noooo no noo noooooooooo noooo noooo

on their bull-like necks. Through the breach, they heard the waters
no noooo nooo-nooo noooo. Noooooo noo nooooo, nooo noooo noo nooooo

pour, as mountain torrents down a flume.
nooo, no nooooooo nooooooo nooo n noooo.




"The ship! The hearse!--the second hearse!" cried Ahab from the boat;
"Noo nooo! Noo nooooo!--noo nooooo nooooo!" noooo Nooo nooo noo nooo;

"its wood could only be American!"
"noo nooo noooo nooo no Nooooooo!"




Diving beneath the settling ship, the whale ran quivering along its
Nooooo noooooo noo nooooooo nooo, noo noooo noo noooooooo noooo noo

keel; but turning under water, swiftly shot to the surface again, far
nooo; noo noooooo noooo noooo, noooooo nooo no noo noooooo noooo, noo

off the other bow, but within a few yards of Ahab's boat, where, for a
noo noo noooo noo, noo nooooo n noo noooo no Nooo'n nooo, noooo, noo n

time, he lay quiescent.
nooo, no noo noooooooo.




"I turn my body from the sun. What ho, Tashtego! let me hear thy hammer.
"N nooo no nooo nooo noo noo. Nooo no, Nooooooo! noo no nooo noo nooooo.

Oh! ye three unsurrendered spires of mine; thou uncracked keel; and only
No! no noooo noooooooooooo nooooo no nooo; nooo noooooooo nooo; noo nooo

god-bullied hull; thou firm deck, and haughty helm, and Pole-pointed
noo-noooooo nooo; nooo nooo nooo, noo noooooo nooo, noo Nooo-noooooo

prow,--death-glorious ship! must ye then perish, and without me? Am I
nooo,--noooo-nooooooo nooo! nooo no nooo nooooo, noo noooooo no? No N

cut off from the last fond pride of meanest shipwrecked captains? Oh,
noo noo nooo noo nooo nooo noooo no noooooo noooooooooo nooooooo? No,

lonely death on lonely life! Oh, now I feel my topmost greatness lies in
nooooo noooo no nooooo nooo! No, noo N nooo no noooooo noooooooo nooo no

my topmost grief. Ho, ho! from all your furthest bounds, pour ye now in,
no noooooo noooo. No, no! nooo noo nooo nooooooo nooooo, nooo no noo no,

ye bold billows of my whole foregone life, and top this one piled comber
no nooo noooooo no no noooo nooooooo nooo, noo noo nooo noo noooo nooooo

of my death! Towards thee I roll, thou all-destroying but unconquering
no no noooo! Noooooo nooo N nooo, nooo noo-nooooooooo noo nooooooooooo

whale; to the last I grapple with thee; from hell's heart I stab at
noooo; no noo nooo N noooooo nooo nooo; nooo nooo'n noooo N nooo no

thee; for hate's sake I spit my last breath at thee. Sink all coffins
nooo; noo nooo'n nooo N nooo no nooo nooooo no nooo. Nooo noo noooooo

and all hearses to one common pool! and since neither can be mine, let
noo noo noooooo no noo nooooo nooo! noo noooo noooooo noo no nooo, noo

me then tow to pieces, while still chasing thee, though tied to thee,
no nooo noo no nooooo, noooo noooo noooooo nooo, nooooo nooo no nooo,

thou damned whale! THUS, I give up the spear!"
nooo nooooo noooo! NOOO, N nooo no noo noooo!"




The harpoon was darted; the stricken whale flew forward; with igniting
Noo noooooo noo nooooo; noo nooooooo noooo nooo noooooo; nooo nooooooo

velocity the line ran through the grooves;--ran foul. Ahab stooped to
nooooooo noo nooo noo noooooo noo noooooo;--noo nooo. Nooo noooooo no

clear it; he did clear it; but the flying turn caught him round the
noooo no; no noo noooo no; noo noo nooooo nooo nooooo noo noooo noo

neck, and voicelessly as Turkish mutes bowstring their victim, he was
nooo, noo noooooooooo no Noooooo noooo noooooooo noooo nooooo, no noo

shot out of the boat, ere the crew knew he was gone. Next instant, the
nooo noo no noo nooo, noo noo nooo nooo no noo nooo. Nooo noooooo, noo

heavy eye-splice in the rope's final end flew out of the stark-empty
noooo noo-nooooo no noo nooo'n noooo noo nooo noo no noo noooo-noooo

tub, knocked down an oarsman, and smiting the sea, disappeared in its
noo, noooooo nooo no noooooo, noo noooooo noo noo, noooooooooo no noo

depths.
nooooo.




For an instant, the tranced boat's crew stood still; then turned. "The
Noo no noooooo, noo noooooo nooo'n nooo noooo noooo; nooo nooooo. "Noo

ship? Great God, where is the ship?" Soon they through dim, bewildering
nooo? Noooo Noo, noooo no noo nooo?" Nooo nooo noooooo noo, noooooooooo

mediums saw her sidelong fading phantom, as in the gaseous Fata Morgana;
noooooo noo noo nooooooo nooooo noooooo, no no noo noooooo Nooo Noooooo;

only the uppermost masts out of water; while fixed by infatuation, or
nooo noo noooooooo noooo noo no noooo; noooo noooo no noooooooooo, no

fidelity, or fate, to their once lofty perches, the pagan harpooneers
nooooooo, no nooo, no noooo nooo noooo noooooo, noo noooo noooooooooo

still maintained their sinking lookouts on the sea. And now, concentric
noooo nooooooooo noooo noooooo nooooooo no noo noo. Noo noo, nooooooooo

circles seized the lone boat itself, and all its crew, and each floating
noooooo nooooo noo nooo nooo nooooo, noo noo noo nooo, noo nooo nooooooo

oar, and every lance-pole, and spinning, animate and inanimate, all
noo, noo noooo noooo-nooo, noo nooooooo, noooooo noo noooooooo, noo

round and round in one vortex, carried the smallest chip of the Pequod
noooo noo noooo no noo nooooo, noooooo noo nooooooo nooo no noo Nooooo

out of sight.
noo no noooo.




But as the last whelmings intermixingly poured themselves over the
Noo no noo nooo noooooooo noooooooooooo nooooo nooooooooo nooo noo

sunken head of the Indian at the mainmast, leaving a few inches of the
nooooo nooo no noo Nooooo no noo nooooooo, noooooo n noo nooooo no noo

erect spar yet visible, together with long streaming yards of the flag,
noooo nooo noo noooooo, nooooooo nooo nooo noooooooo noooo no noo nooo,

which calmly undulated, with ironical coincidings, over the destroying
noooo nooooo noooooooo, nooo nooooooo noooooooooo, nooo noo nooooooooo

billows they almost touched;--at that instant, a red arm and a hammer
noooooo nooo nooooo noooooo;--no nooo noooooo, n noo noo noo n nooooo

hovered backwardly uplifted in the open air, in the act of nailing
noooooo nooooooooo nooooooo no noo nooo noo, no noo noo no noooooo

the flag faster and yet faster to the subsiding spar. A sky-hawk that
noo nooo nooooo noo noo nooooo no noo noooooooo nooo. N noo-nooo nooo

tauntingly had followed the main-truck downwards from its natural home
nooooooooo noo nooooooo noo nooo-noooo noooooooo nooo noo noooooo nooo

among the stars, pecking at the flag, and incommoding Tashtego there;
noooo noo noooo, noooooo no noo nooo, noo noooooooooo Nooooooo noooo;

this bird now chanced to intercept its broad fluttering wing between the
nooo nooo noo noooooo no noooooooo noo noooo nooooooooo nooo noooooo noo

hammer and the wood; and simultaneously feeling that etherial thrill,
nooooo noo noo nooo; noo nooooooooooooo noooooo nooo nooooooo nooooo,

the submerged savage beneath, in his death-gasp, kept his hammer frozen
noo noooooooo nooooo noooooo, no noo noooo-nooo, nooo noo nooooo nooooo

there; and so the bird of heaven, with archangelic shrieks, and his
noooo; noo no noo nooo no nooooo, nooo noooooooooo noooooo, noo noo

imperial beak thrust upwards, and his whole captive form folded in the
nooooooo nooo nooooo noooooo, noo noo noooo noooooo nooo nooooo no noo

flag of Ahab, went down with his ship, which, like Satan, would not sink
nooo no Nooo, nooo nooo nooo noo nooo, noooo, nooo Noooo, noooo noo nooo

to hell till she had dragged a living part of heaven along with her, and
no nooo nooo noo noo noooooo n nooooo nooo no nooooo noooo nooo noo, noo

helmeted herself with it.
nooooooo noooooo nooo no.




Now small fowls flew screaming over the yet yawning gulf; a sullen white
Noo noooo noooo nooo noooooooo nooo noo noo noooooo nooo; n nooooo noooo

surf beat against its steep sides; then all collapsed, and the great
nooo nooo noooooo noo noooo noooo; nooo noo noooooooo, noo noo noooo

shroud of the sea rolled on as it rolled five thousand years ago.
nooooo no noo noo nooooo no no no nooooo nooo nooooooo noooo noo.













Epilogue
Nooooooo




"AND I ONLY AM ESCAPED ALONE TO TELL THEE" Job.
"NOO N NOOO NO NOOOOOO NOOOO NO NOOO NOOO" Noo.




The drama's done. Why then here does any one step forth?--Because one
Noo noooo'n nooo. Noo nooo nooo nooo noo noo nooo noooo?--Noooooo noo

did survive the wreck.
noo noooooo noo noooo.




It so chanced, that after the Parsee's disappearance, I was he whom the
No no noooooo, nooo noooo noo Nooooo'n noooooooooooo, N noo no nooo noo

Fates ordained to take the place of Ahab's bowsman, when that bowsman
Noooo nooooooo no nooo noo noooo no Nooo'n noooooo, nooo nooo noooooo

assumed the vacant post; the same, who, when on the last day the three
noooooo noo nooooo nooo; noo nooo, noo, nooo no noo nooo noo noo noooo

men were tossed from out of the rocking boat, was dropped astern. So,
noo nooo nooooo nooo noo no noo noooooo nooo, noo noooooo nooooo. No,

floating on the margin of the ensuing scene, and in full sight of it,
nooooooo no noo nooooo no noo noooooo noooo, noo no nooo noooo no no,

when the halfspent suction of the sunk ship reached me, I was then,
nooo noo noooooooo noooooo no noo nooo nooo noooooo no, N noo nooo,

but slowly, drawn towards the closing vortex. When I reached it, it had
noo nooooo, noooo noooooo noo noooooo nooooo. Nooo N noooooo no, no noo

subsided to a creamy pool. Round and round, then, and ever contracting
nooooooo no n nooooo nooo. Noooo noo noooo, nooo, noo nooo noooooooooo

towards the button-like black bubble at the axis of that slowly wheeling
noooooo noo nooooo-nooo noooo nooooo no noo nooo no nooo nooooo nooooooo

circle, like another Ixion I did revolve. Till, gaining that vital
nooooo, nooo noooooo Noooo N noo noooooo. Nooo, noooooo nooo noooo

centre, the black bubble upward burst; and now, liberated by reason of
nooooo, noo noooo nooooo nooooo noooo; noo noo, noooooooo no nooooo no

its cunning spring, and, owing to its great buoyancy, rising with great
noo noooooo nooooo, noo, noooo no noo noooo nooooooo, nooooo nooo noooo

force, the coffin life-buoy shot lengthwise from the sea, fell over, and
noooo, noo nooooo nooo-nooo nooo nooooooooo nooo noo noo, nooo nooo, noo

floated by my side. Buoyed up by that coffin, for almost one whole day
noooooo no no nooo. Nooooo no no nooo nooooo, noo nooooo noo noooo noo

and night, I floated on a soft and dirgelike main. The unharming sharks,
noo noooo, N noooooo no n nooo noo noooooooo nooo. Noo noooooooo nooooo,

they glided by as if with padlocks on their mouths; the savage sea-hawks
nooo nooooo no no no nooo nooooooo no noooo nooooo; noo nooooo noo-noooo

sailed with sheathed beaks. On the second day, a sail drew near, nearer,
nooooo nooo nooooooo noooo. No noo nooooo noo, n nooo nooo nooo, nooooo,

and picked me up at last. It was the devious-cruising Rachel, that in
noo nooooo no no no nooo. No noo noo noooooo-nooooooo Nooooo, nooo no

her retracing search after her missing children, only found another
noo noooooooo nooooo noooo noo noooooo nooooooo, nooo noooo noooooo

orphan.
nooooo.

Section  2.  Information about the Mission of Project Gutenberg-tm
Noooooo  n.  Noooooooooo noooo noo Noooooo no Noooooo Noooooooo-no




Project Gutenberg-tm is synonymous with the free distribution of
Noooooo Noooooooo-no no nooooooooo nooo noo nooo nooooooooooo no

electronic works in formats readable by the widest variety of computers
nooooooooo noooo no noooooo nooooooo no noo nooooo noooooo no noooooooo

including obsolete, old, middle-aged and new computers.  It exists
noooooooo nooooooo, noo, nooooo-nooo noo noo noooooooo.  No nooooo

because of the efforts of hundreds of volunteers and donations from
noooooo no noo noooooo no nooooooo no nooooooooo noo noooooooo nooo

people in all walks of life.
nooooo no noo noooo no nooo.




Volunteers and financial support to provide volunteers with the
Nooooooooo noo noooooooo noooooo no noooooo nooooooooo nooo noo

assistance they need, are critical to reaching Project Gutenberg-tm's
nooooooooo nooo nooo, noo nooooooo no nooooooo Noooooo Noooooooo-no'n

goals and ensuring that the Project Gutenberg-tm collection will
noooo noo nooooooo nooo noo Noooooo Noooooooo-no nooooooooo nooo

remain freely available for generations to come.  In 2001, the Project
nooooo nooooo noooooooo noo noooooooooo no nooo.  No nooo, noo Noooooo

Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation was created to provide a secure
Noooooooo Nooooooo Noooooo Nooooooooo noo noooooo no noooooo n nooooo

and permanent future for Project Gutenberg-tm and future generations.
noo noooooooo nooooo noo Noooooo Noooooooo-no noo nooooo noooooooooo.

To learn more about the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation
No noooo nooo noooo noo Noooooo Noooooooo Nooooooo Noooooo Nooooooooo

and how your efforts and donations can help, see Sections 3 and 4
noo noo nooo noooooo noo noooooooo noo nooo, noo Nooooooo n noo n

and the Foundation web page at http://www.pglaf.org.
noo noo Nooooooooo noo nooo no nooo://noo.noooo.noo.
